El Sr. Margarito labora en una empresa de la ciudad, cuenta con un año de antigüedad su esposa la Sra. Rosa labora en una maquiladora desde hace cinco años, tienen un hijo pequeño y con ellos vive la mamá de la Sra. Rosa quien es la que se encarga del cuidado de su hijo mientras ellos trabajan. 
Con la construcción de esta barda podrán estar más tranquilos por la seguridad de sus hijos mientras ellos trabajan ya que debido a la delincuencia se tienen que tomar medidas de este tipo.
texts.en:
Mr. Margarito works in a business in the city where he has been for one year. His wife Ms. Rosa works in a maquiladora (factory) which she has done for five years. They have a small child and Ms. Rosa's mom also lives with them and takes care of their child while they are working. 

With the construction of this wall they will be able to feel more comfortable about their children's safety while they are working since, owing to crime, people must take measures of this sort.

loans.use: to purchase materials and labor costs for building a side wall.

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en:
Anatoli is a hardworking farmer from Crimea. Farming is his full-time job and the only source of income for his family. Anatoli owns 12 hectares of land and rents another 12. The crops that Anatoli grows are very diverse and include cantaloupes, onions, beans and grapes. Recently Anatoli has planted more grapes and, in order to take proper care of his crop and reduce manual labour, he has decided to invest in an irrigation system. 

Please help Anatoli to develop his farm by helping him to buy an irrigation system.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment

loans.name: Gloria Maritza

texts.es: La señora  Gloria Maritza  vive en la  ciudad de Managua se caracteriza por ser una persona Responsable. sus labores cotidianos consisten en  el  cual  llega a su negocio a las 5 am de la mañana y se retira a las 6pm, su  negocio es muy frecuentado ya que brinda una excelente servicio, sus clientes son personas que  viajan al occidente del país,    visito nuestra oficina en Managua   para solicitar Un préstamo  para la compra de paca de ropa americana, doña Maritza tiene 7 años de trabajar con  préstamos de ceprodel,  con  este   va  a comprar pacas  de ropa para  ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de su producto. Gracias a este financiamiento podrá obtener mejores ingresos para el desarrollo de su familia y el crecimiento económico de su negocio.
texts.en: Señora Gloria Maritza lives in the city of Managua. She is characterized as being a responsible person. Her daily work consists of arriving at her business at 5 am in the morning and working until 6 pm. Her business is very popular, since she offers excellent service. Her customers are people who travel to the western part of the country. She visited our office in Managua to apply for a loan to purchase a bale of American clothing. Doña Maritza has worked with loans from CEPRODELl for 7 years. With this one she is going to buy bales of clothing so that she can offer her customers a variety of her products. Thanks to this financing, she will be able to obtain better income for the advancement of her family and the economic growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of American clothing.

loans.name: Hector Luis

texts.es:
Héctor es un hombre de 24 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pareja y su pequeño hijo de un año, quienes son su razón y principal motivo para seguir esforzándose y salir adelante en la vida; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos, y en algunas ocasiones prepara unos riquísimos “Tallarines Rojos” para compartir con su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar una carrera universitaria, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día. 
Desde muy joven Héctor ha realizado diversos trabajos, él siempre ha sido muy trabajador, entusiasta y tiene un gran deseo de superación; actualmente trabaja como chofer de su mototaxi propia, él labora un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender hasta 50 clientes, él cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su trato respetuoso y amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Héctor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un juego de llantas, puertas delanteras y un toldo para su mototaxi; de esta manera Héctor podrá contar con un vehículo acondicionado y en buenas condiciones, con ello espera poder aumentar su clientela e incrementar sus ingresos y así poco a poco en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder adquirir otra mototaxi para expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Héctor, 24, lives in the city of Ica with his partner and young one-year-old child, who are his reason and primary motive for continuing to work and get ahead in life. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends and on occasion he prepares scrumptious tallarines rojos (spaghetti with tomato sauce) to share with his family. Unfortunately due to lack of resources he was not able to go to university, but he dreams of doing it some day. 

From a very early age Héctor has done a variety of work. He has always been very hardworking, enthusiastic and with great desire to overcome. Currently he works as a driver with his own motorcycle-taxi. He works approximately 12 hours a day during which time he can serve up to 50 customers. He believes that his business is going well owing to the respectful, friendly treatment he offers to his customers. 

Héctor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, he will be able to purchase a set of tires, front doors and an awning for his motorcycle-taxi. In this way Héctor will be able to have an vehicle which is outfitted and in good shape with which he hopes to be able to increase his customer base and grow his earnings. Gradually, in the not too distant future, he hopes to be able to acquire another motorcycle-taxi in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase of a set of tires, front doors and an awning for his motorcycle-taxi.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn is forty-two years old and a married mother of three, two of whom work at the factory and one who is still in school. She and her family live in Prey Chhor district. Horn and her husband have been farming rice for almost twenty years. They also raise pigs and cows to earn additional income to support the family. The business earns them around six U.S. dollars per day. 

This is Horn's first time with VisionFund. She applied for the loan to buy more farmland and really hopes that this loan will enable her to grow more rice so that she can make more money to support her child's school fees and so that her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy more farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Matilde Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Matilde tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos.  Ella aprendió el oficio de elaboración de pan por iniciativa propia, debido a que siempre le ha gustado la cocina. Por ese motivo se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan todos los días, en su comunidad y en lugares cercanos. Todo lo que necesita para elaborar el pan, lo compra en una ciudad del oriente del país. Ella aprovecha cada viaje que realiza para comprar harina, manteca, levadura, moldes, etc.

El préstamo que esta solicitando Matilde es para terminar de construir una habitación a su casa y la otra parte será para comprar insumos para la elaboración de pan. Con la inversión ella podrá terminar la habitación para que sus hijos se queden allí, la parte que falta construir es la que se moja cuando llueve. También su familia estará más cómoda y podrá comprar moldes para elaborar pan que tanto necesita. En un futuro Matilde piensa ponerle ladrillo al piso para mayor comodidad de su familia y adquirir un horno más grande.
texts.en:
Señora Matilde is 36 years old. She is married and has three children. She learned the trade of bread-making on her own initiative, inasmuch as she has always liked cooking. For this reason, she makes and sells bread every day, in her community and in nearby locations. She buys everything she needs to make bread in a city in the eastern part of the country. She takes advantage of every trip that she makes to buy flour, lard, leavening, baking tins, etc.

The loan that Matilde is applying for is to finish building a room at her house, and the other part will be used to buy supplies to make bread. With the investment she will be able to finish the room so that her children can stay there. The part that is not finished is the part that gets wet when it rains. Her family will also be more comfortable, and she will be able to buy baking tins that she so much needs for making bread. In the future, Matilde is thinking of putting tile on the floor for the better comfort of her family and acquiring a bigger oven.

loans.use: to finish constructing a room in her house, and the other part will be to purchase supplies to make bread

loans.name: Songorn's Group

texts.en:
Songon, 33, is married with four children, three of whom are still in school. She and her husband earn a living in a rural area of the Kang Meas district by farming rice, making palm sugar and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for nine years. The main challenge for her family’s business is the unhealthy rice crop and insects.

This is the second loan for Songon’s group with VisionFund and they completely paid back the loans, which have enabled her to afford her children’s education and to set aside some savings. With her current business, she can earn around 23,000KHR per day. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund of 1,200,000KHR. Songon, who is the leader, is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland and also buy gasoline for a water pump. She hopes to make more productive rice crops so as to make more income to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school. 

.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Chroeb's Group

texts.en:
Chroeb, 47, is a married mother of two children, one daughter and one son. She earns a living in a rural village of the Kang Meas district through farming and selling rice. The main challenge for her family’s business is the unhealthy rice crop and insects. 

This is the second loan for Chroeb’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund and they successfully paid back the loans which have enabled her to set aside some savings for future needs. With her current business, she earns around 21,000 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. She is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to fertilizer for her farmland and to buy gasoline for a water pump to bring water to her rice farm. She hopes to make more productive rice crops and increase her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and gasoline for a water pump.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Josefa Dolores

texts.es: La señora Josefa dolores vive en la ciudad de Managua madre de familia. el negocio de la señora Josefa es la venta de productos de belleza para damas y caballeros en las empresas su  día de trabajo empieza a las 9 am  y regresa a su casa de habitación a las 4pm , con el préstamo obtenido va poder incrementar su inventario y ofertarle a su clientela variedad   en línea de cosmético y perfume.
texts.en: Josefa Dolores lives in the city of Managua and is a mother.  Her business is selling beauty products for women and men in companies.  Her work day starts at 9 am and she returns to her home at 4 pm.  With the loan obtained she will be able to increase her inventory and offer her customers a variety of cosmetic and perfume lines.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Inez Veronica

texts.es: La señora Inés verónica vive en la ciudad de Managua es una persona responsable trabajadora  el negocio de doña Inés es un comedor donde elabora desayuno, y almuerzo, atiende clientes que trabaja en  las empresas ubicadas cerca de su negocio, este crédito lo solicita para la compra de  granos básicos, perecederos, carnes, jugos, aguas. Con el apoyo de  ceprodel   va a obtener  los productos  para la elaboración de sus deliciosas variedad de comida,   doña Inés tiene 5 años de trabajar  con ceprodel y nos habla de como le han beneficiado,  a través de los créditos le ha permitido incrementar su negocio  con las compra de activos fijos como sillas, mesas, y equipo de  cocina.
texts.en:
Sra. Inés Verónica lives in the city of Managua.  She is a responsible hard worker. Her business is a restaurant where she prepares breakfast and lunch. She serves customers who work for the companies located near her business. She is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, perishables, meat, juice and water. 

With the support of Ceprodel she is going to buy the products she needs to make her delicious varieties of food.  Doña Inés has been working with Ceprodel for five years and tells us how good they have been to her. The loans have enabled her to improve her business through the purchase of fixed assets, such as chairs, tables and kitchen equipment.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, perishables, meat, juice and water.

loans.name: Lesbia Concepcion

texts.es:
La joven Lesbia es soltera,  labora como promotora de turismo ecologico, siendo el objetivo en la mejora de su casa, ya que el techo esta en malas condiciones y esta el invierno, asi como parte de la infraestructura tiene que hacer reparaciones de paredes, vive junto a sus padres, siento el apoyo moral y economico en tiempo de estudios.
Con este financiamiento es para la compra de materiales de zinc, perlines, golosos,hierro bloques, cemento, pintura anticorresiva, clavos, madera para remodelacion de paredes. Y estar en mejores condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en:
The young woman Lesbia is single and works as a tour agent for ecological tourism. Her objective is to improve her house since the roof is in bad shape and it is winter, along with part of the infrastructure as she needs to make repairs to walls. She lives with her parents, being moral and financial support during school season. 

With this loan she will purchase corrugated metal roofing material, beams, screws, iron, cement, cinder block, corrosion-resistant paint, nails and wood for remodelling walls, so she may have better living quarters.

loans.use: to purchase corrugated metal roofing material, beams, screws, cement, cinder block and other items for beginning construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greenhouse

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es:
El señor Héctor tiene 51 años de edad. Él proviene de una familia de escasos recursos económicos, debido a eso desde los 12 años de edad trabaja en la agricultura. Por esa razón no pudo estudiar en la escuela, porque como hermano mayor tenia que trabajar para ayudar a los gastos de la casa, pues eran 8 hijos en el hogar y él se preocupaba por sus hermanos y trabajaba muy fuerte para que no les faltara nada. Ayudo a todos sus hermanos para que estudiaran hasta el sexto grado y es así como don Héctor ha adquirido una gran experiencia en su trabajo. 

Para comprar todos sus insumos agrícolas, el señor Héctor recorre media hora de camino a pie hasta el desvió principal, para esperar el autobús que lo conducirá hasta la ciudad que esta a unos cuarenta y cinco minutos. Luego se regresa en el mismo autobús con los materiales hasta el desvió donde abordo el autobús, después él paga un vehiculo para que se los lleven hasta su casa, ya que el autobús no llega hasta su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar semilla mejorada, abono, fertilizantes y para pago del alquiler del terreno donde cultivara. Con la inversión podrá producir maíz, el cual es indispensable para sobrevivir él y su familia y lo venderá cuando el precio este bueno y le permita obtener ganancias de su producción. 

Él desea ahorrar para realizarle unos arreglos a su casa donde vive, debido a que tiene cuartones de madera deteriorados, tejas quebradas, etc.
texts.en: Mr. Hector is 51 years old.  He comes from a family of limited financial resources, and because of that has worked in agriculture from the age of 12. As a result, he could not study in school, because as the older brother, had to work to help with the household expenses.  There were 8 children at home and he cared for his siblings and worked very hard to not missing anything. He helped all his siblings to study through sixth grade and this is how Don Hector has acquired extensive experience in his work. To buy all agricultural materials, Hector runs half an hour's walk to the main diversion to await the bus that takes him to the city, about forty-five minutes away. Then he is back on the bus with the materials and then he pays a vehicle to take him home because the bus does not come to his house. The loan his is requesting to the Fundación Campo, is to buy improved seed, fertilizer, and to rent the land where he will cultivate. With the investment will produce corn, which is essential for him and his family’s survival, and will sell when the price is good.  This will enable him to profit from his production. He wants to save for some repairs to his house, because it has deteriorated wooden scantlings, broken tiles, etc..

loans.use: to buy improved seed, fertilizer, and to rent the land where he cultivates.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Dambae district, Ny is aged 33 and married. She has five sons dependent on her and all of them are still in school. 

Like other villagers, Ny has been farming rice and planting cassava for several years to make a living. This enables her to earn around 37,500 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses.

This is the third loan for Ny with VisionFund and she completely paid back the loans. After the two loans, she is able to afford food with sufficient nutrients for her family. 

Now requesting a loan, she will use it to buy fertilizer and use a portion of it to spend for land preparation. She hopes to make more income so as to keep her children in school until they finish.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan, 61, lives in a rural village of the Dambae district and she is a married mother of six children, four of whom are her responsibility working at the family’s business. She is a farmer who has been planting cassava on five-hectare farmland for 20 years and farming rice on 0.5 hectare of farmland for eight years to support the family. Flooding and the cheap price of cassava crops are the main challenge for her in making a living. The average daily income she earns from the current business is around 37,000 KHR.

Yan received a first loan with VisionFund one year ago and the loan has enabled her to better support her big family and lease a plot of plantation. With a good business, she is applying for another loan with VisionFund to buy fertilizer and use a portion of it to spend for land preparation. She hopes to increase her family’s income to make their lives better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farmland.

loans.name: Samoeun's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Dambae district, Samoeun is a 32-year-old mother of two dependent sons and one of them is still in primary school. She has been farming rice and planting cassava as the family’s main source of income for several years. This business earns her around 130,000KHR per day. With her current business, she has been challenged with the decrease of cassava’s price.

This is the third loan for Samoeun and the first loan for her group, Oun with VisionFund. Having been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, she can afford to purchase a hand tractor for her farming work. She is now leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for farmland. She hopes to increase her crops and sell it for a good price, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farmland.

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en:
Mab and her family live in a cottage, built from bamboo, located in a village in Dambae district, where the common business is planting cassava. Mab is 39 years old and married. She has one child who is still in school. 

Mab and her husband have been growing cassava for three years, to support their family. Mab's group consists of four members, three females and one male. She is now leading the group to apply for other loans, after their previous loans have been repaid. As the leader, Mab plans to use her portion to spend on labor fees, to hire someone to clean grasses from her farm and also to buy fertilizers. She hopes this loan will allow her to grow good yielding crops and, hence, she can sell the products for a higher price. This will ensure that she will be able to feed her family better and her child can remain in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and on pay labor fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an irrigation system

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
El señor Rufino tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Él es tractorista desde que tenía 18 años de edad, viajo a Guatemala, estando allá, trabajo como jornalero y aprendió a manejar el tractor agrícola, cuando cumplió los 20 años regreso a El Salvador y trabajo como tractorista para muchos jefes. La agricultura es un oficio que heredo de sus padres, después que se regreso a Guatemala comenzó a trabajar propio, debido a que antes trabaja en conjunto con su familia.

Don Rufino compra todos sus insumos agrícolas en una ciudad del oriente del país, aunque comenta que este año aprovechara la oportunidad del paquete agrícola proporcionado por el gobierno del país para disminuir el gasto.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar los insumos agrícolas para sembrar 28,000 metros cuadrados de maicillo y 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz. Él también se dedica a alquilar terrenos a otras personas. Por el momento los tiene desocupados y presenta una gran oportunidad ya que con las lluvias aprovechara para sembrar y luego moler el zacate para después venderlo. Así sus ingresos mejoran sustancialmente, ya que el vende el zacate en época de escasez de alimentos para el ganado. A él le gustaría trabajar con ganado de una forma propia, debido a que ha trabajado suficiente tiempo con ganado ajeno y hoy quiere hacerlo con el suyo.
texts.en:
Rufino is 46 years old, married and has three children. He has been a tractor driver since he was 18 years old. He went to Guatemala, being there, working as a day laborer and learning to drive an agricultural tractor for many bosses. Agriculture is work he inherited from his parents, and after they returned to Guatemala he began with his own work, as before he worked together with his family. 

Rufino buys all his agricultural supplies in a city in the east of the country, although he comments that this year he will take advantage of the opportunity of the agricultural package provided by the government of the country to reduce expenses.

The loan that he is applying for through Fundacion Campo, is to buy agricultural supplies in order to plant 28,000 square meters of sorghum and 3,500 square meters of corn. He also rents land to other people. Currently he is unemployed and a big opportunity has come along because of the rains in order to plant and later grind the grass in order to later sell it. In this way his income will improve substantially, as hay sold in times of shortages for the livestock. He would like to work with his own livestock, because he has worked long enough with other people’s and now would like to do it with his own.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to plant 28,000 square meters of sorghum and 3,500 square meters of corn

loans.name: Sreyne

texts.en:
A villager from the Dambae district of Cambodia, Srey is a 27-year-old married mother of two dependent daughters. Cassava planting is the single business for her to make a living, which enables her to earn around 41,000KHR per day. 

Sreyne has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and she has completely repaid back the loans, which have helped her better support her family. After the two loans with VisionFund, she is confident to make her living successfully. Now, applying for another loan, she will use this loan to spend for land preparation and to pay labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn a larger income in order for her to set aside some money to plant rubber trees.

loans.use: to spend for land preparation and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr:
La cliente est présidente du groupe de crédit  Shangilieni, elle lève sa main sur la photo, veuve, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous.  Son mari est décédé vers les années  2005 suite à une courte maladie. Pendant ce temps, elle supporte seule la charge de ses enfants. Cette charge pèse lourdement sur la croissance rapide de son business.  Elle est sociétaire d’une minu Quincaillerie. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce ce business. Elle  a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari avant qu’il décède. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit du programme de l’IMF  Hekima. Avec  le crédit de  l’IMF Hekima, la cliente souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 10 rouleaux des fils électriques,  6 dizaines des  Scies, etc. En plus, cette cliente vend également des Fanta, bières Primus  à son domicile pour accroitre son revenu et répondre aux petites urgences de ménage.
Ainsi, la cliente remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit de manière permanente sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle a parvenu à construire une maison en planche de 10 chambres, qu’elle met à location. Les recettes de loyer de cette maison lui permettent  de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The client, with her hand raised in the photo, is the president the Shangilieni lending group. She is a widow and the mother of 7 children who are all in school. Her husband passed away in 2005 after a short illness. 

Since then, she has been the sole provider for her children. This responsibility weighs heavily upon the rapid growth of her business. 

For 8 years, she has worked in a mini hardware store. She started her small business with the money that she received when her husband died.

After that, she received a loan from IMF Hekima. With the loan from IMF Hekima, the client would like to increase her sales by buying 10 roles of electrical wire, 6 dozen saws, etc. In addition, the client also sells Fanta and Primus beer out of her home to increase her revenues and to respond to minor household emergencies.

The client would like to thank IMF Hekima for the loans that she received without the need for collateral. It is because of these loans that she was able to construct a 10-room plank house that she rents out. The rental income from this house allows her to respond to the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 10 rolls of electrical wire and 6 dozen saws.

loans.name: On's Group

texts.en:
On, aged 39, is married and has three children, all of whom are still in school. Her family lives in Dambae district and has been farming rice and growing cassava for 15 years. A main constraint for their business is when the price of cassava drops. On has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and this first loan has helped her to sufficiently feed her family. 

On is now leading a female group member, new to VisionFund, to request another loan after On's first loan has been repaid. As the leader, On will use her portion to spend on fertilizers and seedlings for her plantation. She strongly hopes that this loan will enable her to make more income by selling good quality crops. She hopts that she can reserve enough finances to support her children's education until they finish school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 43 years old. She is a mother of one son. She resides, with her husband, in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in producing palm sugar for more than ten years, earning approximately $8 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her son is a construction worker who earns about $4 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Ny is requesting a loan of $625 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase will enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan, 21, is a married mother of two dependent children, residing in a rural village of the Dambae district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. Like other villagers, cassava planting and rice farming are the main sources for her family’s income, which she has been involved in for several years. 

Phan is a second cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she completely repaid the first loan. This has enabled her to gradually increase her income. Currently, she is able to earn around 32,000KHR per day. With a good business, she is applying for a loan with VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Jose Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor José Adolfo vive el en  la ciudad de Managua  tiene su  negocio en su casa y también viaja alos departamentos a vender sus productos, su esposa se queda atendiendo el negocio en la casa. 
Es el segundo crédito con ceprodel don jose también oferta abanicos, plancha, licuadora, producto de aluminio y productos plásticos  el  dia de trabajo para don José   empieza a las 6am y regresa a su casa de habitación alas 7pm.
Con crédito de ceprodel va a comprar peroles y sillas plastica para ofertársela a sus clientela
texts.en: Jose Adolfo lives in the city of Managua.  He has a business in his home and also travels to other districts to sell his products while his wife looks after the business in their home.  This is his second loan with CEPRODEL.  Jose also sells fans, irons, blenders, and aluminum and plastic products.  His work day starts at 6 am and he returns home at 7 pm.  With the loan from CEPRODEL he will buy pots and plastic chairs to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy aluminum and iron pots and plastic products.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn is 33 years old and married. She lives her husband and three dependent daughters in a village located in the Dambae district of Cambodia. One of her daughters is still in school. Her family’s income comes from rice farming and cassava planting, which has enabled her to to earn around 27,000KHR per day. Like other villagers, cheap prices of cassava crops is the main challenge for her family’s business as well.

This is the fourth loan for Sorn with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her to better support family. Now requesting another loan, she wants to use this loan to buy fertilizers and also to spend on land preparation. She hopes this loan will enable her to prosper in her business and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for farmland.

loans.name: Hoeun's Group

texts.en:
Aged 60, Hoeun is a married mother of six children, two of whom are still dependent and in school. Rice farming on a one-hectare piece of farmland is the family’s only source of income. Hoeun has been in this business for almost twenty five years. The main challenge for her is the lack of working capital to support her business. 

Hoeun has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and has completely paid back the loan while her group members, Sophat and Khoeun, are just starting with VisionFund this loan cycle and for one cycle, respectively. Now she can earn around 16,000KHR per day. Requesting this loan, Hoeun, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and she will use a portion of the loan on land preparation. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mearn

texts.en:
Mean is 31 years old. He is a father of one child and resides with his wife and a sister in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a veterinarian who earns about $10 per day. His wife is a garment worker who earns about $3 per day. 

Mean is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a store for his sister to run a cosmetic business. This purchase will enable his sister to generate more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand the business and help his child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his present house to make it more comfortable for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a store for his sister to run the cosmetic business.

loans.name: Dina's Group

texts.en:
A citizen residing in a rural village of the Dambae district, Dina is aged 36 and has two dependent children, one daughter and one son, who are still in school. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice and planting cassava for five years. To better support her family, Dina sells grocery items to gain additional income. This enables her to earn up to around 44,000KHR per day. Cheap price of cassava crops is a main challenge for her business. 

Dina’s group of two female members has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle and they completely paid back the loan with VisionFund. Now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR each, Dian, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to make a better living and save some money to extend her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: María Encarnación

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Trabajando Para Un Futuro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 57 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad,  uno de ellos aun  viven con ella.

Nuestra amiga para salir adelante sola se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, para lo cual tiene en su casa una pequeña granja para los pollos y un corral para sus chanchos, ella  compra por cajas los pollos cuando están pequeños y los cría por tres meses y luego los vende en pie o por libras a los vecinos o entrega a los comerciante o en tiendas de la localidad, de igual y de la misma forma lo realiza con los chancho solo que estos entrega siempre a los comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa cundo tiene un animalito para vender. Trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas por día ya que esto es algo que no le quita mucho tiempo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos y alimentos para pollos y chanchos. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

Su sueño es tener una granja más grande y un carro.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte, the members of the communal bank, "Trabajando para un Futuro" [Working for a Future] meet every two weeks.  This place is known for its delicious sweets that the townspeople make that are known throughout the entire country.  It is also known for the warmth of its friendly and hard-working people.

Señora María lives here.  She is 57 and is separated, but she has 5 children from her marriage who are all adults.  One of them still lives with her.

To get ahead on her own, our friend makes a living by raising chickens and pigs.  She has a small farm at her home for the chickens and a corral for the pigs.  She buys the chickens by the box when they are young, and she raises them for 3 months and then either sells them live or by the pound to her neighbors, or she delivers them to the merchants at stores in the area.  She does the same with the pigs except she always delivers them to merchants who come to her house when she has an animal to sell.  She works every day from 2 to 3 hours a day since this is something that doesn't take up a lot of her time.  

She will use this loan to buy chickens and chicken and pig feed.  She is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because of the help that the loans give her.  Her dream is to have a bigger farm and a car.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken and pig feed.

loans.name: Maritza De La Paz

texts.es:
Maritza, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para crecer en el negocio, pues quiere invertir en la compra de CD, juguetes, hilos, pulseras, accesorios, para poder mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio, esto le ayudara a Maritza a que sus clientes permanezcan.
Ella manifiesta que su efecto con la inversión anterior fue positivo, mejorando las ventas y dándole una mejor estabilidad en el comercio. En su familia espera mejorar poco a poco su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza is requesting a new loan to expand her business. She wants to buy compact discs, toys, threads, bracelets, and accessories. These will improve the availability of products in her business and help her with client retention. 

The prior loan was put into good use by increasing sales and making the business more stable. She hopes to improve her family's quality of life bit by bit.

loans.use: to buy compact discs, toys, threads, bracelets, and accessories.

loans.name: Ronald Ivan

texts.es:
Don Ronald, sigue laborando en mecanica, es un hombre trabajador con mucha expectavivas a futuro, para su familia de cinco hijos en donde espera poder hacerle un techo digno, y que ahora que tiene la oportunidad de estos financiamiento, esta motivado para construir su casa de concreto, hoy en dia hecha de zinc. 
Este es su segundo prestamo, con el primero compro piedra, y bloques, Hoy con este nuevo prestamo comprara: cemento, hierro, arena, para luego comenzar la obra ya que ira por ciclo, por que tiene que cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Ronald continues to work as a mechanic.  He is a hard-working man with many hopes for the future for his family of five children.  He wants to be able to provide them with adequate housing, and now that he has the opportunity of this financing he is motivated to build a concrete house, as the one he has now is made of metal.  This is his second loan.  With the first loan he bought stone and concrete blocks.  Now with this new loan he will buy: cement, iron, and sand, with which to start the work later.  He is building in stages because he has to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, iron and sand.

loans.name: Roger Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Roger Alberto vive en la ciudad de Managua tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación  es su segundo crédito con ceprodel, gracias a estos crédito él a podido surtir su venta de diferentes productos de consumo diario para su clientela.
Don Roger va a utilizar el préstamo para compra de gaseosa,  granos básicos, jabón, y otro producto que oferta a diario en su pulpería, ya que manifiesta que con un buen inventario mejoraras su ganancia. 
El señor Roger esta agradecido con ceprodel por la oportunidad de haberle dada financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones económica.
texts.en:
Sr. Roger Alberto lives in the city of Managua. He runs a business in his home. This is his second loan with Ceprodel. Thanks to this loan he has been able to stock his store with different daily consumption items for his customers.

Don Roger is going to use the loan to purchase soft drinks, basic grains, soap and other products that he sells daily in his small store because he says that with a good inventory his profits improve.

Sr. Roger is grateful to Ceprodel for the opportunity of having having been given funding to improve his economic conditions.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ernesto José

texts.es:
El señor Ernesto José vive en la ciudad de Managua es una persona responsable trabajadora padre de familia, tiene su negocio de cerrajería en un mercado de la capital el señor empezó su negocio desde hace 20 año como cerrajería pero a través de los años ha ido creciendo en el negocio  decidió empezar con venta de accesorio para celular y reparación de celulares.
Con el préstamo  que le otorgue  ceprodel lo va a utilizar para la  compra    de cargadores para celulares, batería, celulares, y  llaves.  Ernesto comenta  que con los  que le a financiado la institución  le ha permitido incrementar su negocio en la compra de herramientas de trabajo y por ende tener mejores ganancia. Por lo cual esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad de superación que este le ofrece, ya que podrá dar una vida mejor para su familia.
texts.en: Señor Ernesto José lives in the city of Managua and is a responsible, hard-working person and father.  He has a locksmith's business in a market in the capital.  He started his business 20 years ago as a locksmith's shop, but through the years, he has grown it.  He decided to start selling accessories for cell phones and to repair cell phones.  With this loan from Ceprodel, he will buy cell phone charges, batteries, cell phones, and keys.  Ernesto says that the financing he has received has allowed him to increase his business and buy work tools and therefore make better profits.  He is very grateful for the opportunity to improve himself since he will be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy cell phone chargers, batteries, cell phones, and keys.

loans.name: Bazarbu

texts.ru: Базарбу  42 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, с 2007 года Базарбу занимается животноводством и земледелием, стартовав с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодня в хозяйстве Базарбу имеется 14 овец, 12 коз и земельный надел мерою 1,58-га, где она выращивает хлопок и кукурузу. Ежемесячная прибыль  от продажи сельхоз продукции составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Базарбу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы Базарбу планирует вложить в обучение своих детей.
texts.en: Bazarbu is 43 years old, married, with three children. Since 2007, Bazarbu has been raising livestock and working the land, in order to earn a living for her family. At present Bazarbu's farm includes 14 sheep, 12 goats and a land plot of 1.58 ha [about 4 acres], where she grows cotton and corn. Her monthly income from selling agricultural products is 15,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Bazarbu turned to "Bai Tushum& Partners" for a loan in the amount of 135,000 KGS so as to buy cattle for fattening and resale. Bazarbu plans to use the resulting income for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tile to put in her living room.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina, aged 19, is married and lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She earns a living through farming rice and planting cassava. She has been in this business for just one year. This business enables her to earn around 31,000 KHR per day. The main challenges for her are having an unhealthy rice crop and encountering cheap cassava prices.

This is the first loan for Dina with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make healthy crops and sell them for a good price, in the hopes of making a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Simleng's Group

texts.en: Simleng is 42 years old and a married mother of two, both of whom are students. She and her husband have been farming rice for almost two decades. The business usually struggles when natural disasters destroy her crops. Simleng has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. The first loan has helped her children's education, in terms of financial support, while enabling her to build some savings. Now, Simleng is leading a group of two members to request another loan. She hopes to get her share to spend on having her land plowed and buying fertilizers and seedlings. Simleng strongly hopes this loan will enable her to generate more income to expand her business and also have a proper house for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings and have the land plowed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: María Betzabé

texts.es:
La Señora María Betzabé es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre de una hija la que ha criado con mucho esfuerzo, cariño y tratado de dar una buena educación donde uno de sus mayores sueños es verla preparada como excelente profesional para que tenga un mejor futuro.
Se desempeña como profesora de primaria en un colegio de la localidad donde ha brindado sus servicios por más de diez años para el aprendizaje de los niños.
Cuenta con su propia vivienda, una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un préstamo para mejorar el techo de dicha vivienda por lo que comprará zinc y pago de mano de obra.
Espera que Ceprodel le siga apoyando con estos créditos, ya que hoy tiene un mejor nivel de vida porque tiene su propia vivienda y solo con esta ayuda es que se pueden realizar los sueños de un asalariado.
texts.en:
María Betzabé is a native of the town of El Sauce.  She is the mother of one daughter whom she has raised with a lot of effort and affection, and tried to give a good education.  One of her biggest dreams is to see her trained as an excellent professional so she will have a better future.  She works as an elementary school teacher in a school in the town where she has worked for more than 10 years teaching children.

She has her own house.  One of her necessities right now is to get a loan to improve the roof of her house, for which she will buy metal sheeting and pay for labor.

She hopes that CEPRODEL continues helping her with these loans because today she has a better standard of living because she has her own house.  Only with this help can the dreams of a wage-earner be achieved.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Epina Luz

texts.es:
Epina es una mujer de 38 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus 2 hijos, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias se separó de su esposo, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo “Trigo con Bisteck” plato preferido por su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudor cursar una carrera universitaria, pero gracias al apoyo de su familia y con mucho esmero culminó una carrera técnica de corte y confección. 
Por iniciativa propia y gracias a su espíritu emprendedor, Epina puso en marcha su negocio de venta de alfalfa, así también brinda servicios de corte y confección de prendas de vestir, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender buena cantidad de clientes, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su buen gusto, dedicación y trato amable con sus clientes.
Epina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del pago de la mano de las personas encargadas de la construcción de su casa, de esta manera Epina terminará la construcción de 3 cuartos en su vivienda para darlos en alquiler y así poco a poco desea poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos para poder brindar un mejor futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Epina is a 38-year-old woman who lives in the city of Nazca with her two children. Unfortunately for several reasons she separated from her husband. Since then she has put all of her efforts towards getting her family ahead. In her spare time she likes to spend a little while reading, and on some occasions she makes a delicious "trigo con bistec" [Peruvian wheat and steak dish], which is her family's favorite. 

Regrettably, due to a lack of economic resources, she was not able to study at a university; but thanks to her family's support, and with great care, she finished a technical degree in dressmaking. On her own initiative, and thanks to her enterprising spirit, Epina started her business selling alfalfa, while also offering dressmaking services. She dedicates approximately 10 hours a day to her business, in which she can assist a good number of customers. She believes that her business is doing well because of her good taste, dedication, and friendly demeanor with customers. 

Epina is very appreciative to the Kiva lenders, as it's thanks to their help that she will be able to cover the labor costs of the people charged with the construction of her house. In this way Epina will finish the building of three rooms in her home, which she will rent out. In this way, little by little, she wants to increase her economic income in order to offer a better future to her children.

loans.use: to cover the labor costs of construction.

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María Lourdes en la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua. Su actividad en el negocio es de venta de frescos naturales. 
Nos cuenta doña María que su día de trabajo empieza a las 6 am y termina a las7 pm ,gracias a los crédito que la señora a recibido a podido mantener su producto a su clientela, el dinero obtenido de este préstamo lo va a ocupar para la compra de frutas, azúcar, bolsas, y frijoles por quintal  para incrementar su ventas y obtener un margen de ganancia mejor
texts.en: Señora María Lourdes lives in the city of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua.  She has a business selling fruit juice.  María tells us that she starts her work at 6 a.m. and finishes at 7 p.m.  Thanks to the loan that she received, she was able to sustain her products for her customers.  She will use this loan to buy fruits, sugar, bags, and beans by the 100 kg bag to increase her sales and obtain a larger profit margin.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, and fruit.

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
Karin es una joven madre de 19 años, ella junto a su pequeño hijo, Ángelo de 2 años, viven en la casa que sus padres le dieron como herencia para estar tranquila y así tener una mejor vida. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en un pequeño espacio que acondicionó en su vivienda hace un año. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder conversar y aconsejar a sus clientes para que lleven la prenda correcta. Sin embargo, lo que es difícil es tener que descuidar a su pequeño hijo mientras realiza sus ventas, pero aun así, sigue adelante para que logre tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado. Asimismo se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. 
Con los 2,500 nuevos soles de este préstamo viajará a la ciudad de Lima para comprar la ropa que necesita, prendas ligeras para el calor, por la zona donde vive.
texts.en: Karin is a young, 19-year-old mother.  She lives with her young son, Ángelo, who is 2, in her parents' house that they gave her as an inheritance so she can have peace of mind and a better life.  She makes a living by selling clothing in a small space she fixed up in her home a year ago.  What she likes most about her job is talking with and advising her customers so they can take home the right piece of clothing.  Nevertheless, it's difficult to have to leave her son while she makes her sales, but this is how she can get ahead and obtain a better quality of life.  This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she feels happy for the support that is being offered to her.  This is why she promises to make her payments on time.  With the 2,500 PEN from this loan, she will travel to the city of Lima to buy the clothing she needs (light clothing fbecause of the heat) for the area where she lives.

loans.use: to travel to the city of Lima to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun, age 62, is married with six children. Two of them are dependents. Rice farming is the only source of income for her family, who lives in a village in the Prey Chhor district. She has been in this business for 23 years. The main challenge for her is lack of working capital to better support her business. With her current business, she can earn around 40,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day to spend on daily expenses. 

This is Sun's first loan with Kiva’s field partner VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland, buy wooden boards for house building, and pay for labor. She hopes this loan will enable her business to prosper and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Afepeb Group

texts.fr: AFEPEB est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Houénangnon Abibatou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un peintre du nom de Jean-Pierre. Le couple n’a aucun enfant. Houénangnon Abibatou vit avec son mari. Houénangnon Abibatou a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Houénangnon Abibatou assure avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis près de quinze ans, Houénangnon Abibatou vend des tissus et des plateaux d’œufs dans un quartier du Bénin. Houénangnon Abibatou s’approvisionne dans une région et un marché du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Houénangnon Abibatou et les autres membres du groupe AFEPEB sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Afebep is a group of four members living in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Houenangnon Abibatou (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 33 years old and married to Jean-Pierre, a house painter. They have no children. Houenangnon Abibatou lives together with her husband. She stopped her education at the primary school level. Houenangnon Abibatou and her husband jointly provide for various household needs. For almost 15 years, Houenangnon Abibatou has been selling fabric and cartons of eggs in a district of Benin. Houenangnon Abibatou stocks up at a certain market in a region of Benin. This is the fourth time that Houenangnon Abibatou and the other members of Afebep group are seeking financial support from ALIDe in order to bolster their working capital and enhance their business by better meeting customer demand. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric as well as cartons of fresh eggs.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 44 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su pareja y su hijo de 16 años, él es un hombre muy trabajador y empeñoso, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para salir adelante con su familia; con mucho esmero Jorge culminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos y noticieros en la TV y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo “Cau Cua”, el  cual es el plato favorito de su familia. 
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Jorge trabaja en su asuto propio como chofer de taxi, él dedica a su labor un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender buena cantidad de pasajeros, su negocio marcha bien debido a su trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.
Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de llantas y el mantenimiento general que necesita su auto; de esta manera Jorge podrá contar con un auto en buenas condiciones y brindará un mejor servicio a sus clientes, incrementando así sus ingresos y poco a poco gracias al dinero que pueda ahorrar Jorge desea poder asegurar el futuro profesional de su hijo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge, 44, lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago with his partner and their 16-year-old son. He is a hard working and determined man, who focuses his efforts in getting ahead with his family. With much effort, Jorge completed his high school studies. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources he was not able to pursue a University degree. He would have liked to study Civil Engineering. During his free time, he likes to watch educational programs and the news shows on TV. In some occasions he likes to cook a delicious "Cau Cau", which is his family's favorite dish. 

With much determination and enthusiasm, Jorge works on his own as a taxi driver. He works approximately 12 hours a day during which he can drive a fair quantity of passengers. His business is going well given his polite and respectful manner to clients. Jorge is very thankful with the Kiva lenders, since with their help he will be able to buy tires and carry out general maintenance required for his car. Jorge can then count on his car's improved condition to provide better service to his clients. Thus, increasing his earnings so that he can save bit by bit to help secure a professional future for his son and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and perform general maintenance on his car.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María Cristina es una mujer muy alegre, a sus 54 años siempre está al pendiente de su familia. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, Mauro de 50 años, y sus cuatro hijos, a quienes les brinda amor y una buena educación. 
Hace 28 años que se dedica a la venta de comestibles (arroz, azúcar, verduras, conservas, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros). En la atención cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja y sus hijos (ocasionalmente) para dar una buena atención a sus clientes. Ella comenta que es importante ganarse la confianza y animarlos que regresen a seguir comprando en su tienda, pues les ofrece variedad de productos. Desde que empezó con esta labor, no dudó ni un instante en seguir haciéndolo crecer, ya que le es rentable. Para más adelante desea ampliar su casa para que pueda agrandar su tienda, ya que este negocio es lo que mejor sabe hacer.

Este es su crédito número 17 con MFP, pues conoció a esta institución hace varios años, por lo que siempre ha sido puntual con sus pagos. Asimismo, agradece el apoyo que tiene para seguir con sus planes de trabajo.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo abastecerá de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
María Cristina is a happy woman.  At her 54 years of age, she is always watching over her family.  She lives in her own home with her husband, Mauro, who is 50, and their 4 children, to whom they give love and a good education.

For 28 years, she has made a living selling food (rice, sugar, vegetables, canned goods, candy, drinks, etc.).  Her husband helps her with her business, and her children do occassionally to give good service to their customers.  She says that it's important to earn the trust and to motivate them to return and keep buying at her store.  She can offer them a variety of products.  Since she started this work, she didn't doubt for an instant that she could make it grow, since it is profitable.  In the future, she hopes to expand her home so she can expand her store, since this business is what she knows how to do best. 

This is her seventeenth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  She became familiar with this institution several years ago, and she has always been punctual with her payments.  With the 2,000 PEN from this loan, she will stock up on merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two bulk supplies of clothing.

loans.name: Kimhourn

texts.en:
Kimhourn, pictured here, is 31 years old. She is hired by her fellow villagers to farm and gets paid in fees. Her husband, Thoeun, who is 30, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2003, and they have three children--one son and two daughters. One is in school, and the others are still young. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kimhourn is requesting her first Kiva loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to get to work, because Kimhourn’s husband commutes to work by riding a bicycle. Taking a bicycle to work is tiring and makes it hard to arrive on time.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to get to work

loans.name: Róger Noel

texts.es:
El joven Róger Noel es un Sauceño dedicado al comercio que desde muy pequeño se ha caracterizado por ganarse la vida por sí solo, cualidad que le enseñaron sus padres para que se defendiera en la vida por sí mismo.
Hoy en la actualidad tiene su propio negocio el cual consiste en brindar servicio de Nintendería a los pobladores de dicho municipio donde tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual le ha permitido tener sus propios ingresos para llevar el sustento a su pequeño hogar.
Una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir dos televisores para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ya que hay ocasiones que por la falta de estos no pueden atender a más clientes, por tal motivo se acercó por primera vez a Ceprodel a solicitar el primer crédito para cumplir su objetivo y así ganar más clientes.
Espera que Ceprodel apruebe su solicitud para poder cumplir su meta y llegar a tener una relación duradera con tal Institución.
texts.en:
Róger Noel is a young man from El Sauce who works as a merchant.  From a very young age he has distinguished himself by earning a living for himself, a quality his parents taught him so he could get by in life on his own.

Currently he has his own business offering video games to the residents of that town.  He has done this work for many years, which has allowed him to have his own income to support his little home.

One of his needs right now is to get two television sets to be able to meet his customer demand, because there are times when he doesn't have them and he can't serve additional customers.  For this reason he came to CEPRODEL for the first time to request his first loan to realize his goal and attract more customers. 

He hopes that CEPRODEL approves his application so he can achieve his goal and come to have a lasting relationship with the institution.

loans.use: to buy two television sets.

loans.name: Sangorn

texts.en:
A villager from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sangorn is aged 54 and married with five children. Two of them are still in school while the other three work for the family business. To make a living, Sangorn has been farming rice on a two-hectare farmland and planting cassava on a one-hectare farmland for almost twenty five years. Low prices of cassava crop are her main challenge in making a living.

Sangorn has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and has completely paid back the previous loans. The past loans have enabled her to better support her family. Currently, she is able to earn around 45,000KHR per day. She is going to use the loan she is requesting now to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for land preparation. She hopes to make more income so as to live better and keep her children in school until they finish.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar vive en la casa que compró junto a su pareja, Héctor. Fruto de ese amor tienen dos hijos: Karen de 9 y Joseph de 5 años, a quienes desean ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas (pollo y papas fritas con ensalada) por la noche, en la parte de afuera de su vivienda. Empezó con esta actividad hace un año y comenta que tiene buenos ingresos, ya que siempre tiene clientes que consumen lo que prepara. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es que siempre cuenta con el apoyo de pareja, quien también atiende sus campos de cultivo, pero en las noches la apoya en lo necesario.  Por otro lado, sus clientes salen a gusto al terminar de comer, ya que la sazón de Pilar es muy buena; el único problema es que le hace falta ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Con el tiempo, desea tener un restaurante, pero por ahora prioriza mantener su actual negocio. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente contenta de contar con el apoyo y confianza de las personas que le brindan este crédito. 
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles solicitados comprará una mesa y algunas sillas para que sus clientes estén más cómodos.
texts.en:
Pilar lives in the home that she bought with her husband, Héctor.  As a fruit of their love, they have 2 children:  Karen, 9, and Joseph, 5, to whom they hope to offer a better quality of life.

She makes a living by selling fast food (chicken and fries with salad) at night outside of her home.  She started this business a year ago, and she says that it makes good income since she always has customers to eat what she makes.  What she likes most about her job is that she always has her husband's support.  He also attends to his fields, but at night, he supports her with what she needs.  Her customers leave pleased after they eat, since the flavors Pilar uses are very good.  The only problem is that she needs to offer more comfort to her customers.  With time, she hopes to have a restaurant, but now her priority is to maintain her current business.

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and hse is happy to have the support and trust of the people that are offering it to her.  With the requested 1,500 PEN, she will buy a table and some chairs so her customers can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a table and chairs for her food stand.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer muy laboriosa de 35 años. Es soltera, pero madre de tres hijos, a quienes les brinda amor y educación. Vive en la casa que logró comprar hace 10 años, la construyó a base de madera.
Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos para sus hijos y luego se dirige a vender sus platos de comida en el frontis de su vivienda, donde implementa una mesa con algunas sillas para que sus comensales se sientan cómodos. Esta labor la empezó hace 2 años, desde que su esposo la dejó y tenía que hacerse cargo de sus hijos sola.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se siente contenta por tener otra oportunidad para mejorar su negocio. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por permitirle formar parte de ellos y ser un grupo solidario y unido. 
Con los 1,000 nuevos de este préstamo comprará otra mesa y más sillas, con el resto adquirirá comestibles para seguir preparando las diferentes comidas que ofrece.
texts.en:
Martha is a hard-working, 35-year-old woman.  She is a single mother of 3 children, to whom she offers love and an education.  She lives in the home that she bought 10 years ago.  It was built out of wood.

She gets up very early to make food for her children, and then she goes out to sell her food in front of her home, where she set up a table and some chairs so her guests feel comfortable.  She has done this work for 2 years, since her husband left her and she had to take care of her children alone.

This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is happy about having another opportunity to improve her business. She is grateful to her communal bank for allowing her to be a part of a supportive and united group.

With the 1,000 PEN from this loan, she will buy another table and more chairs.  She will use the remainder to buy food to keep preparing the different dishes she offers.

loans.use: to buy a table, chairs, and supplies to make food.

loans.name: Frank Edihno

texts.es:
Frank es un joven de 31 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Parcona, el distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es un distrito en el cual se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, en especial programas de humor, asimismo en algunas ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos, el solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Derecho.

Día a día Frank se levanta muy temprano para preparar sus deliciosos panes con cerdo, así como preparar sus refrescos, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene una buena sazón para la preparación de sus panes y sobre todo con mucha amabilidad para atender a los clientes.

Frank está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá  comprar un carrito con cocina incorporada para poder ofrecer en su negocio bebidas calientes ya que estamos en temporada de invierno, con esta mejorar podrá ofrecer más productos para sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando día a día con mucho entusiasmo y poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un gran restaurant”.
texts.en:
Frank is a 31 year old young man who lives in the district of Parcona. Parcona District is known for having a warm and welcoming climate. It is a district where agriculture has developed, especially the cultivation of cotton.

In his spare time, Frank enjoys watching television, especially comedies. Occasionally he also enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz con Pollo”. Due to scarce economic resources he was only able to study until high school however he would have liked to have studied law. 

Day after day Frank gets up very early to prepare his delicious pork buns as well as his soft drinks. He works around 10 hours a day and can wait on up to 30 customers daily. He believes that his business is doing well because he prepares the bread with a good seasoning and above all because he waits on his customers so pleasantly.

Frank is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to purchase a cart with a built-in kitchen. Thus, he will be able to offer warm drinks to his customers now that we are in the winter season. With this improvement, he will be able to offer more products to his customers and improve his earnings. This will allow him to continue working day after day very enthusiastically and he will be able to make his greatest dream a reality: “Owning a fine restaurant”

loans.use: to purchase a cart with a built-in kitchen.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es:
Melchora es una viuda desde hace 2 años. Tiene 58 años y dos hijas (Hilda de 19 años y Guisela de 15 años). Las tres viven en la casa que compró con su difunto esposo hace 25 años. 
Desde muy temprano, Melchora se levanta para preparar el desayuno, aunque en eso a veces su hija mayor la apoya. Luego se dirige a sus campos de cultivo donde tiene sembrado plantas de café, cuyas cosechas las lleva a vender a los centros de acopio de su localidad, con lo que les paga a las personas que le apoyan a extraer los frutos. Desde muy pequeña le enseñaron las labores agrícolas, por lo que ahora con mayor experiencia, sabe cómo obtener una producción de buena calidad. Lo que más anhela es que sus hijas sean profesionales y tengan una mejor calidad de vida, es por ello que sigue trabajando para poder solventar sus estudios. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se siente agradecida con las personas que la apoyan con sus planes de trabajo. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal  por ser socios solidarios. 
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará sacos de abono para esparcir en sus plantas de café, y así obtener una buena producción en su siguiente cosecha.
texts.en:
Melchora has been a widow for two years. She is 58 years old and has two daughters (Hilda aged 19 and Guisela aged 15). The three of them live in the house she bought with her husband twenty five years ago.

Since early in the morning, Melchora prepares breakfast, although her older daughter helps her sometimes. Then, she goes to the field where she has planted coffee. She sells the harvest in the local distribution centers and pays the manual labor who helped her with the harvest. She learned about farming from a very early age. With her added experience, she knows how to obtain a good-quality yield. She strongly wishes for her daughters to become professionals and have a better quality of life, which is why she continues to work to pay for their studies.

This is her second loan with Microfinanciera Prisma (MFI) and she's thankful with the people supporting her work plans. Likewise, she thanks her communal bank for being supportive partners. 

With the 1,000 nuevos soles (PEN), she will buy fertilizer by the sackful to scatter over her coffee plants and obtain a good yield for the next harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Yieng's Group

texts.en:
Aged 56, Yieng is a married mother of seven children, only one of whom is a dependent and works in a garment factory. Rice farming is the family’s only source of income and she has been in this business for almost twenty three years. The main challenge for her is the flood affecting her rice farming. 

Yieng has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely paid back the loans while her group member has been with VisionFund just for this loan cycle. With the loan, she is confident that she will gradually improve her living condition. Now she can earn around 21,000KHR per day. Yieng, who is the leader of the group, will use her portion of the loan, to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion to pay for labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle and set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
Ermelinda es una mujer de 34 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus 3 pequeños hijos, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella se dedica por completo a sacar adelante a su familia, ella es una mujer muy empeñosa y entusiasta que ha trabajado desde muy joven, lastimosamente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder ser profesora de lengua. 
Por iniciativa propia y gracias a su deseo de salir adelante, Ermelinda puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella dedica  a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender un promedio de 25 clientes, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a sus buenos precios y buena atención.
Ermelinda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que requiere comprar clavos, listones y debe pagar la mano de obra de las personas encargadas de la construcción; de esta manera podrá contar con una vivienda en mejores condiciones que brinde mayor bienestar y seguridad para sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Ermelinda is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa with her three small children. Sadly, due to different circumstances, she separated from her partner. Since then she has dedicated herself completely to moving her family forward. She is a very hardworking and enthusiastic women who has worked since very young. Regrettably, due to a lack of economic resources, she was unable to complete primary school, but she would have liked to have been a language teacher. 

Through her own initiative and thanks to her desire to get ahead, Ermelinda started her small business selling groceries. She dedicates approximately 12 hours a day to her business, during which time she may wait on an average of 25 customers. She believes that her business is doing well because of her good prices and good service.

Ermelinda is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help provided, she will be able to meet the expenses of improving her dwelling. She needs to buy nails and slats and pay the workers doing the construction. This will enable her to have a house in better condition that provides greater comfort and security for her small children.

loans.use: to make improvements on her dwelling.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy activa y empeñosa. Es soltera, pero madre de tres hijos, a quienes desea que tengan un buen futuro. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas en diferentes variedades. Esta labor la lleva realizando hace 2 años y comenta que durante ese tiempo le ha ido muy bien. Asimismo, le es rentable porque está en una comunidad donde hay mucho tránsito de personas, por eso está pendiente de tener stock de sus productos. En sus tiempos libres cuida de sus hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Para el futuro, desea que sus hijos sean hombres de bien y tengan una mejor calidad de vida, para lo cual prioriza hacer crecer su negocio para darles una buena educación.

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP y está satisfecha de recibir el apoyo de todas las personas quienes le brindan este préstamo, el cual le ayudará a seguir con sus planes de trabajo. Por otro lado, agradece a su banco comunal por trabajar con personas fraternas.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados se abastecerá de bebidas para surtir su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Margarita is 39 years old and is an active and motivated woman.  She is the single mother of three boys who she wants to have a good future

She sells different types of drinks and has been doing this for two years and tells us that things have gone well for her business during this time.  It has also been profitable because it’s located in a community where there is a lot of movement of people, so she’s careful to keep a stock of her products.  In her spare time she spends time with her children, who are her primary motivation for her efforts.  In the future she wants her sons to be men of means and for them to have a better quality of life, so her priority is to grow her business so that she can provide them with a good education.

This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she is happy for having received the support of all those who have provided her with this loan which will help her continue with her work plans.  She is also grateful to her communal bank for working with friendly people.

She will use the 2,000 PEN to stock up on drinks to offer an assortment at her point of sale.

loans.use: to stock up on drinks.

loans.name: Renedicto

texts.es:
Renedicto es un hombre activo y muy trabajador, tiene 32 años. Vive con Ercilia, de 31 años, y sus tres hijos, en la casa que compararon con mucho esfuerzo.
