She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. In 2009, Henrietta joined GDMPC. In the future, Henrietta wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman having 2 children. She is 45 years old, residing at Mantik, Tangub City, Philippines. Elizabeth owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 2 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.. She joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Elizabeth wants to build a house and to finish the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Telmo Anibal

texts.es: Telmo de 58 años se dedica a la reparación de artículos electrónicos en su domicilio ubicado en Suburbio. Hace 10 años aprendió el oficio trabajando para un amigo y le gusto mucho. A raíz de eso se dio cuenta que le gustaba mucho esta profesión y la mantiene hasta el día de hoy. Actualmente es independiente contando con bastantes clientes. Arregla lo que son televisores, reproductores de dvd, equipos de sonido, etc. el trabajo lo realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. No tiene ayudantes ya que de momento el negocio no le da suficientes ganancias para contratar uno y pagarle de manera diga por sus servicios. Telmo nos indica que uno de sus más grandes problemas se presenta cuando los clientes no retiran los equipos que mandan a reparar. Con el crédito comprar diodos, chips, herramientas que necesita para la reparación. Su meta futura es poder habilitar otros departamentos para alquilar ya que con esto se ayuda en la economía. Su sueño es que uno de sus nietos le guste la electrónica y la aprenda.
texts.en: Telmo, 58, repairs electronics in his home located in Suburbio. He learned this trade 10 years ago, working for a friend and he really enjoyed it. So, from this experience, he realized that he really liked this profession and has been doing it from that day until now. He is independent and has lots of clients. He repairs televisions, DVD players, stereos, etc. He works from 8 am to 6pm. He has no help as he can’t afford to pay someone a dignified wage for their services. Telmo tells us that the biggest problem he faces is when the clients don’t pick-up their equipment after it’s been repaired. With this loan, he will buy diodes, chips and tools that he needs to make repairs. His future goal is to renovate other apartments so he can rent them out and that would help him out economically. His dream is that one of his grandsons will enjoy electronics and learn the trade.

loans.use: buy diodes, chips and tools.

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.es:
El señor Perfectos es un agricultor desde hace 40 años prácticamente casi toda su vida a trabajado en esto y es parte de sus ingresos al  hogar, el cultiva 2 manzanas de  tierra en piñas y desea darles mantenimiento para tener una buena  cosecha y poder vender en un buen precio  su producto.
Gracias a este financiamiento que se le otorga podrá comprar los suministros necesarios  como Urea, completo, cipermetrina para que sus cultivos crezcan sanos.
texts.en:
Sr. Perfectos, 40, is a farmer.  He has worked on farms for almost his whole life and farming is his sole source of income.  He grows pineapples on 2 tracts of land and says that he needs to take care of the crop in order to get the best price for it at market.  
He will use this loan to buy the supplies he needs--fertilizer, etc.--to ensure a good yield.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Hoeurng

texts.en:
Hoeurng is 52 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than 4 years, earning approximately 5 USD per day. Her husband helps her run the business. All of her children are still in her care. 

In order to improve her family’s finance, Hoeurng is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase more groceries to sell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Neth

texts.en:
Neth is 64 years old. She is widowed and resides with one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling Khmer noodle for more than 7 years, earning approximately 4 USD per day. Her child is employed and earns about 3 USD per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finance, Neth is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase clothes to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Ayidote Minavo Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE MINAVO est un groupement de vingt deux personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, Christine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Clément. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Christine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Christine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la maison, Christine vend depuis près cinq ans, divers produits (farine de manioc, savons, huile de palme) dans une région du Bénin. Christine s’approvisionne dans sa région. C’est la première fois que, Christine et les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE MINAVO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: AYIDOTE MINAVO is a group of twenty two people who live in the same village. The representative of the group, Christine (who has her hand raised in the photo) is 40 years old and is married to a farmer called Clement. They have six children, all of whom go to school and are dependent on them. Christine did not go to school. She lives with her children and her husband. The couple shares the various expenses of the household. In order to contribute to the household expenses, for the last five years Christine has been selling different products (manioc flour, soap, palm oil) in a region in Benin. Christine buys her products in her district. This is the first time that Christine and the other members of the AYIDOTE  MINAVO group request financial support from ALIDé with a view to strengthening their working capital and their business and improving the satisfaction of their customers.

loans.use: to buy manioc flour and palm oil.

loans.name: Benito Ricardo

texts.es: Benito a sus 63 años es una persona muy productiva, le gusta mantenerse activo y por eso tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Vive en las Orquídeas sector norte de Guayaquil. Su esposa Pascuala es ama de casa y sus hijos son mayores de edad. El nos comenta que el negocio lo inicio su hija teniendo buenos resultados por lo que decidió invertir. Luego de esto su hija se quedo con el bazar y él empezó su tienda de productos. Benito nos comenta que inicia sus actividades a las 6:30 de la mañana luego de atender a su esposa, cerrando a las 11 de la noche. Ya tiene 10 años en el negocio y no se queja porque con ello mantiene a su esposa quien esta delicada de salud. Los productos que vende son de fácil salida como cuadernos, plumas, colas, jugos, snacks, víveres, arroz, azúcar, pañales, espera poder incrementar sus ventas con el préstamo ya que tendría más productos para la venta.
texts.en: Benito at his 63 years is a very productive person.  He likes to stay active, so he has a grocery store in his home.  He lives in Orquídeas, a section of Guayaquil.  His wife, Pascuala, is a housewife and their children are fully grown.  He says that his daughter started the business and had good results.  She later kept the paper goods store and he started the grocery store.  Benito tells us that he begins working at 6:30 am and closes at 11:00 pm.  He’s been doing this for 10 years and he doesn’t complain because he supports his wife with it and she has health problems.  The items he has, such as notebooks, pens, colas, juices, snacks, food, rice, sugar, and diapers are quick sellers.   He expects to increase his sales with the help of this loan because he will have more products for sale.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Narin (pictured here), age 26, is a garment worker. She lives about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband, Sokha, age 27, has full time employment. They have just been married since 2012 and have no children yet.   

Narin is applying for her first loan of 1,500 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work. Narin’s husband works at Phnom Penh and he rents a place of house to stay. With a motorbike, which he will buy with money from the loan, he will be able to come back home every evening to help support his wife at home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan owns a cellphone counter named based on the street where he lives. His shop is located in an intersection where a lot of people passing by with motorcycles or walking. In his shop, other than selling Ruma’s prepaid cell phone minutes, Ruslan also sells some drinks and does small phone repair services. The reason why he decided to join Ruma’s Loket Ruma bill-payment business is because he sees the demand especially to pay electricity bills and landline phone bills. 

Ruslan is married and has three children who are 27, 20, and 7 years old. With this loan he wants to expand his business. By becoming a Loket Ruma agent, people will come to his counter and pay their bills or buy prepaid electricity vouchers.

This loan is going to be used to pay the deposit for an Electronic Data Capture (EDC) machine. All the payment transactions will use the EDC machine to process everything. Above all, Ruslan’s goal is to generate more profit from his business.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Sohoueto 3 Group

texts.fr: SOHOUETO 3 est un groupement de vingt trois personnes, dont les membres se connaissent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe,  Adjuavi Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 60 ans et est mariée à un certain Philippe. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à leur charge.  Adjuavi Marie a très peu fréquenté l’école.  Adjuavi Marie vit ensemble avec son enfant à charge et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans,  Adjuavi Marie vend des céréales (riz, maïs, haricot, farine de manioc, huile) à son  domicile.  Adjuavi Marie s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. C’est la première fois que  Adjuavi Marie et les autres membres du groupe SOHOUETO 3 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
SOHOUETO 3 is a group of 23 persons whose members know one another in the same district. The group's representative, Adjuavi Marie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 60 years old and married to a man named Philippe. They have four children, all having schooling, of whom one remains in their care. 

Adjuavi Marie has had very little schooling. She lives together with her dependent child and her husband. The couple jointly ensures that the different household expenses are covered. 

For nearly ten years, Adjuavi Marie has been selling grains (rice, corn, beans, cassava flour, oil) out of her home. She gets her supplies from a region in Benin. 

This is the first time Adjuavi Marie and the other members of the group SOHOUETO 3 have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolster their working capital and their businesses and to respond better to the requirements of their customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of  rice, corn, and beans

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is 41 years old and married with 2 children, who are in school. Leonora works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery stock to sell. Leonora has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, detergent and rum. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough to continue her children's education and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 52 years old, married, and has four children. For over 14 years in Poblacion, Bonifacio, she has made a living by selling fruits and vegetables. She earns 4,000 PHP a month from this business. In 2011, Rosita joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more produce to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Orlandine

texts.es:
Orlandine tiene 30 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa y su pequeña hija de tan solo 5 años de edad y por la cual trabaja muy duro cada día para darle una vida digna y sobre todo que sea feliz. Su vivienda se encuentra en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, plátano, entre otros. Orlandine anteriormente vivía en un distrito alejado de Imperial pero debido a las lluvias perdió su casa y tuvo que emigrar hacia la ciudad de Imperial ya que se quedo sin nada ni un lugar donde vivir, debido a ello un familiar cercano lo ayudo y le brindo vivienda. Desde hace 10 años, Orlandine trabaja como carpintero, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 7 clientes diariamente; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque a pesar de las adversidades sigue saliendo adelante y sobre todo porque tiene mucha fe en Dios.

Orlandine está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá implementar mejor su negocio con herramientas como cepillos de madera, cortadora y mejorar su local, así el podrá tener las herramientas adecuadas y sobre todo un mejor lugar donde poder realizar su trabajo, de esta manera el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Darle una buena profesión a su hija y poder crecer en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Orlandine, 30, lives with his wife and little daughter, who is only five years old.  He works very hard every day to give her a decent life and above all for her to be happy.

His house is in the city of Imperial, a city distinguished by its warm and welcoming climate.  There is also agriculture in this city, especially the crops of cotton, corn, and bananas, among others.  Previously Orlandine lived in a district far away from Imperial but he lost his home from the rains and was left with nothing, not even a place to live, so he had to migrate to Imperial.  Because of this a neighboring family helped him and gave him a place to live.

Orlandine has worked as a carpenter for 10 years.  He works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to seven customers.  He believes that it's going well for him in his business because he continues getting ahead despite the adversities and especially because he has a lot of faith in God.

Orlandine is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to equip his business better, with tools such as wood brushes and a saw, and make improvements on his shop.  This way he'll have suitable tools and a better place to do his job.  He'll be able to improve his income and continue working and fighting to make his biggest dream come true: "To give his daughter a good profession and be able to grow in his business."

loans.use: to buy tools and to improve his shop.

loans.name: Tovinonvigbe Group

texts.fr: TOVINONVIGBE est un groupement de douze personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, Brigitte (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Erick. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. En plus de leur enfant, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Brigitte vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de trois ans, Brigitte vend du maïs et des conditions dans une région du Bénin, ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux diverses charges familiales. Brigitte s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Brigitte et les autres membres du groupe TOVINONVIGBE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: TOVINONVIGBE is a group of twelve people, whose members live in the same village. The representative of the group, Brigitte (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old and married to a man named Erick. The couple has a child who attends school and is dependent on them. In addition to their child, they have another child who is dependent on them. Brigitte lives with her husband and her children. The couple shares the household expenses. For three years, Brigitte has been selling corn and condiments in a locality in Benin which enables her to contribute to the family expenses. Brigitte buys her products in a region of Benin. This is the first time that Brigitte and the other members of the TOVINONVIGBE group request financial aid from ALIDé with a view to strengthening the working capital of their business and to give more satisfaction to their customers.

loans.use: to buy corn and condiments.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha vive en las Orquídeas sector norte de Guayaquil. Tiene 33 años y está casada con Silvestre quien se dedica a la venta de jugos y granizados. Hace 12 años tomo la decisión de abrir un bazar en su domicilio. Empezó vendiendo productos de belleza y ropa por catalogo, con las ganancias que obtuvo compro una vitrina en la que expone sus productos. Actualmente vende cuadernos, cartulina, plumas, borradores, colonias, moños etc. de esta manera a obtenido mejores ganancias. Atiende todos los días desde las 6 y media hasta las 10 y media, su estrategia es abrir temprano por la época estudiantil. Tiene 4 hijos de 4, 3, 2 y 1 año de edad, solo dos estudian en la escuela fiscal del barrio. Espera obtener el préstamo para comprar mercadería con esto incrementara el bazar ya que es el sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Martha lives in Las Orquídeas to the north of Guayaquil. She is 33 years old. She is married to Silvestre who sells juices and iced drinks. Twelve years ago, Martha made the decision to open a bazaar in her home. She started by selling beauty products and clothing from catalogs. With the earnings from those sales, she bought a display cabinet to show her products. Currently, she sells notebooks, poster board, pens, erasers and other items in order to earn more income. She works at her shop every day from half past six until half past ten. Her strategy is to open early for the students. She has four children. They are four, three, two and one years old. Two of them attend a local school. She hopes to obtain this loan in order to purchase merchandise. With the merchandise, she will be able to expand the bazaar since it is  her family’s means of support.

loans.use: purchase supplies like notebooks, poster board, pens, etc.

loans.name: Ahuehuete Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo continúan en la misma actividad que que estaban desempeñando. Todos ellos le dan las gracias a Kiva y a Vision Fund (FRAC) por confiar en ellos: ""stamos agradecidos con ustedes por ayudarnos a crecer los negocios y con nuestras familias". 

La señora Gina Rebeca tiene 39 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja quien es taxista. Es madre de 3 hijos: 2 mujeres, una de ellas ya está casada, y 1 varón, también casado. Gina Rebeca solicitó su préstamo para darle mantenimiento a sus taxis; a uno le va a ajustar el motor y al otro le va a dar servicio: cambio de aceite, de balatas y de llantas. Ella comenzó su actividad económica hace 16 años porque algunos conocidos la invitaron a formar parte del grupo de taxistas y le pareció una buena idea. 

Su negocio es muy importante porque gracias a él obtiene las ganancias para comprar alimento, vestido y calzado; además de que tiene la oportunidad de ahorrar. Gina Rebeca es conocida por brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Como mujer emprendedora enfrenta los costos elevados de la gasolina, sin embargo, está muy feliz con el préstamo que va a recibir. Con el dinero prestado podrá ajustar el motor de su taxi para que esté en buenas condiciones y pueda seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que toda su familia goce de buena salud y también seguir trabajando para heredarles a sus hijos el negocio de los taxis en un futuro.
texts.en:
The members of the group are continuing to carry out the same work as they have been. They are all grateful to Kiva and the Vision Fund (FRAC) for trusting in them; “We are thankful to you for helping us grow our business and support our families.” 
	
Gina Rebeca is 39 and lives in a common-law marriage with her partner, who is a taxi driver. She is the mother of 3 children: 2 females, one of whom is married, and 1 male, who is also married. Gina Rebeca has requested the loan for maintenance on her taxis. She will adjust the engine of one and will service the other: changing the oil, brake lining, and tires. She started her work 16 years ago because some of her acquaintances invited her to be part of a group of taxi drivers, and it seemed like a good idea to her. 

Her business is very important because it allows her to earn an income to purchase food, clothes, and shoes; in addition, it gives her the opportunity to save money. Gina Rebeca is known for offering her clients good service. This enterprising woman faces the increased cost of gasoline; nevertheless, she is very happy to receive the loan. With the loan, she will be able to adjust the engine of the taxi so it will be in good condition and can continue offering good service. Her hopes and dreams are that all her family can enjoy good health. She also hopes to continue working so that she can leave the taxi business to her children in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her taxis: changing oil, brake lining, and tires, and adjusting the engine.

loans.name: Martha Delia

texts.es: Desde Isla Trinitaria conocemos a Martha quien vende ropa y cosméticos de manera ambulante. Tiene 37 años y se considera una persona muy dinámica y conversona. De allí surgió la idea ya que sus familiares le indicaron que tenía carisma para vender. Empezó con la venta de productos para ver si obtenía resultados y así fue. Ahora vende ropa porque es de más fácil salida y le deja mejores ganancias. Ella nos comenta que sus productos son de buena calidad y vende los vestidos a $25 dólares, perfumes a $ 20 y las cremas a $ 20 teniendo 5 dólares de utilidad por producto. Martha es madre soltera de un niño de 6 años quien asiste a la escuela fiscal es por eso que lucha día a día, recorriendo y vendiendo. Con el crédito que solicita comprara productos para el negocio. Espera en próximos años tener un local para poder dedicarle más tiempo a su hijo.
texts.en:
On Isla Trinitaria we meet Martha, who sells clothing and cosmetics in the street.   She is 37 and is considered to be a very dynamic and talkative person.  From this, an idea arose because her family pointed out that she had the charisma to sell.  She began by selling products to see if she would get results, and so it was.  Now she sells clothing because it is quite easy to go out with and it gives her more profit.  She tells us that her products are of good quality, and she sells the dresses at $25, perfumes at $20, and the creams at $20, taking $5 of profit per product.  

Martha is a single mother of one child who is 6-years-old and goes to public school.  This is why she fights day to day, traveling through the streets and selling.  With the loan she has asked for, she will buy products for her business.  In the next few years she hopes to have a small shop in order to be able to spend more time with her son.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun is 40 years old and married. She has two boys who are both students. Her family lives in a wooden house located in the Me Mot district. 

Oun and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for 20 years to support the family. This is the first time Oun obtained a loan from VisionFund. For her group member, this is the second loan. 

Oun is the leader of the group, and she used her portion to buy fertilizers for her crops and also to spend on land plowing. She hopes this loan will help to better feed her family and that her children can be in school until graduated.

loans.use: To pay for land plowing and fertilizers.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Sabana

texts.en:
Sabana is 22 years old and her husband, Sophea, is 27 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2008 and have one young daughter.    

Sabana is a garment worker. Sabana’s husband’s business is in renting out his van to drive garment workers to work and back home. Unhappily, his van broke and he decided to sell it. 

She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy a new van for her husband. He will use money from selling his old van to add to money from the loan to buy a new one.

loans.use: To buy a new van for her husband.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 51 years old and lives in Upper Centro,Tudela. She is widowed with two children. Edna works as a government employee and earns approximately PHP 5000 each month. Edna has requested a loan of PHP 20000 to purchase additional housing materials and equipment. Edna has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Edna hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials and equipment.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie, a 25-year-old married mother of one child, lives in Sta. Maria, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

For over five years, she has made a living through the operation of a retail store selling a variety of paper products. She earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Angelie joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 30 years old and has four children who all go to school. She owns a retail business where she sells different items and has spent 10 years in the business. With the loan, she will buy more beer, sugar, yeast, sorghum and bananas for resale. She wants to use the profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more beer, sugar, yeast, sorghum and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is 57 years old and his wife, Sony, is 50 years old. They have been married since 1979 and they have four sons and three daughters. Two are married and live separately, one is a garment worker, one is an auto repairman, one stays at home and the other two attend school. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sarin and his wife are primary school teachers. He is requesting his first loan in the amount of $1,300 to buy a motorbike for his son, who is a garment worker, to get to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his son to get to work.

loans.name: Sohoueto 4 Group

texts.fr: SOHOUETO 4 est un groupement de vingt quatre personnes, dont les membres se connaissent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Florentine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Jacques. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Florentine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Florentine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de onze ans, Florentine vend divers produits (conserves, lait, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) à son domicile. Florentine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Florentine et les autres membres du groupe SOHOUETO 4 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
SOHOUETO 4 is a group of 24 persons whose members know one another in the same district. The group's representative, Florentine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 38 years old and married to a man named Jacques. They have three children, all in school and in their care. 

Florentine did not go to school. She lives together with her children and her husband. The couple jointly ensures that the different household expenses are covered. 

For nearly eleven years, Florentine has been selling grains (canned food, milk, pasta, etc.) out of her home. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

This is the first time Florentine and the other members of the group SOHOUETO 4 have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolster their working capital and their businesses and to respond better to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy various goods (canned foods, milk, pasta, etc.)

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn, 22, is single and lives in Balon,Tudela. She grows crops to earn a living and has been doing this for five years. Jenelyn has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase additional fertilizer, such as inorganic and commercial types. Jenelyn has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Jenelyn hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer, such as inorganic and commercial.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario vive en Quevedo junto a su esposo quien labora en el campo. A sus 46 años es panificadora, aprendió el negocio de su esposo quien le enseño la elaboración. Hace 7 años juntos reunieron el capital necesario para abrir la panadería la cual está ubicada en su domicilio. Comenzaron comprando un horno de segunda mano pero actualmente tienen uno nuevo. Ella empieza la elaboración del pan desde las 3 de la mañana con la ayuda de su esposo y termina a las 2 de la tarde, luego de eso empieza la venta. Rosario nos indica que les da trabajo a varios jóvenes para que recorran la zona. De esa manera mejoran sus ventas que esperando a los clientes, este método le resulta muy útil y de mas ganancias. Con el préstamo espera comprar una vitrina, harina, levadura y huevos necesarios para la elaboración del producto. A futuro le gustaría arreglar la panadería con paredes de cemento mejorando así su aspecto, también una amasadora de pan para ayudar en la elaboración.
texts.en: Rosario lives in Quevedo with her husband who works in the field. At 46 years old, she is a breadmaker; she learned the business from her husband, who taught her. Seven years ago they saved enough money and opened the bakery, which is located in their home. When they started out, they bought a secondhand oven, but currently have a new one. She starts making bread with her husband’s help at 3am and finishes at 2pm, but then the selling begins. Rosario tells us that they give work to a few young people who go around their area to sell.That way, they improve their sales without having to wait for customers; this has proven very useful and generates more earnings. With the loan she is requesting, she’ll buy a glass showcase, flour, yeast and eggs to make bread. In the future, she’d like to renovate the bakery by adding cement walls to improve how it looks and buy a kneading machine to help in the elaboration of the bread.

loans.use: buy flour, yeast and eggs.

loans.name: Francisca Noemy

texts.es:
Francisca, vive con su esposo y cinco hijos, 4 de ellos son menores de edad y uno es independiente, el negocio de Francisca es la venta de tamarindo y la agricultura, este negocio lo hace desde hace 10 años, tambien compra legumbres para vender.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas como los herbicidas, abono, pues quiere iniciar el cultivo de maíz, tambien comprara tamarindo, para seguir vendiendo, este préstamo le ayudara para realizar sus actividades y proveer de sus fuentes de ingresos.
La aspiración de francisca es mejorar en todo lo relacionado a su familia, los ingresos, los negocios, la vivienda, el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisca lives with her husband and five children, 4 of them are minors and one is independent. Francisca’s business is selling tamarind and farming, which she started 10 years ago. She also purchases legumes to sell. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase agricultural materials such as herbicide and fertilizer. She wants to start growing corn. She also wants to purchase tamarind to continue selling it. This loan will help her carry out her work and keep her income sources well stocked. 

Francisca’s aspiration is to improve everything related to her family: her income, her businesses, her home, and the future of her children.

loans.use: purchase herbicide and fertilizer

loans.name: Para Siempre Group

texts.es:
María Concepción tiene 36 años de edad y está casada con el señor Guadalupe, quien es maestro. La pareja tiene 3 hijos: un hijo de 14 años de edad y gemelos de 6 años. María Concepción es comerciante y tiene un negocio en el mercado central, ella se dedica a la venta de carne de res. Según la cantidad de ventas que tenga, son las veces que tienen que matar la res, aproximadamente es un animal dos o tres veces a la semana. María Concepción piensa mejorar su negocio ya que tiene tres personas que le ayudan a la matanza. Después de 5 años de experiencia, una de sus principales metas son tener más reses de reserva y comprar algunos aparatos que ocupa en su negocio como el molino para carne molida y una máquina para cortar la carne.

María Concepción es integrante del grupo "Para Siempre", dicho grupo está integrado por once personas que a continuación serán mencionadas junto con su actividad económica: Paula vende comida; Jorgina, pan; María Concepción, carne; Quintina, pan; Itzel, comida, Danelia, huaraches para dama y caballeros; Norma, productos de abarrotes; Eridia, cosméticos; Celsa, zapatos; Ma del Rocio, chilate y Ricarda, dulces y ropa.
texts.en:
María Concepción is 36 years old and is married to Guadalupe, who is a teacher.  This couple has 3 children: a 14 year-old son and a pair of 6 year-old twins.  María Concepción is a merchant; she has a store in the central market where she sells beef.  Depending on the quantity of sales she has, there are times when she has to slaughter a cow; this happens about 2 or 3 times a week.  María Concepción is planning on improving her business; she already has 3 people who help her do the slaughtering.  After 5 years of experience, one of her main goals is to have more cows on reserve, and to buy some equipment that is used in her business, which is a meat grinder to make ground meat, and a machine to cut the meat.

María Concepción is a member of the group "Para Siempre," which is made up of 11 people who will be mentioned below, along with their economic activity.  They are: Paula, who sells food; Jorgina, who sells bread, María Concepción, who sells meat; Quintana, who sells bread; Itzel, who sells food; Danelia, who sells woven leather sandals for men and women; Norma, who sells groceries; Eridia, who sells cosmetics; Celsa, who sells shoes; Ma de Rocio, who sells chilate (a corn-based beverage); and Ricarda, who sells sweets and clothing.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her butcher shop, such as a meat grinder and knives

loans.name: Romanita

texts.en:
Romanita is married and has four children. Romanita is 52 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Orqouieta City, Misamis Occidental , Philippines.

Romanita is a farmer who grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. 

She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase fertilizers for her crops.
 
Romanita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Romanita hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Sohoueto 5 Group

texts.fr: SOHOUETO 5 est un groupement de vingt six personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Urmine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un jardinier du nom de Christophe. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Urmine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Urmine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la famille. Depuis près de sept ans, Urmine vend des tissus dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Urmine vend des céréales. Urmine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Urmine et les autres membres du groupe SOHOUETO 5 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
SOHOUETO 5 is a group of 26 persons whose members live in the same district. The group's representative, Urmine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 38 years old and married to a gardener named Christophe. They have two children, both in school and in their care. 

Urmine did not go to school. She lives together with her children and her husband. The couple jointly ensures that the different family needs are covered. 

For nearly seven years, Urmine has been selling cloth and in her district. Secondarily, she sells grains. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

This is the first time Urmine and the other members of the group SOHOUETO 5 have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering their working capital and their businesses and to respond better to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy cloth and grains (rice, corn, beans)

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with a zinc roof located in Dambae district, Pha and her family have been farming rice and growing cassava for 20 years. Pha has two children, one of whom is a dependent child. 

Their business earns them on average 13,000 KHR per day. This is the first time Pha and her group member received loans from VisionFund. Pha is the leader, and she used her shares to buy fertilizers and seedlings. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow good quality crops and hence sell the crops for a higher price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en:
Khayal is 26 years old who works as a market vendor selling different kind of goods, such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, ketchup and candies. He has four years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and the demand of clients. 

He sells food products that are very popular among people such as butter, candies and beverages. His monthly profit from his business is 150 AZN.  His father helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the family's sole source of income. Khayal is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location in the central bazaar of his home town.

He has applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods to cover customers` demand.

loans.use: to buy and diversify food products.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza is from Garang, Tangub City. She is 57 years old. Feliza is a widow and has two children. 

To make a living, Feliza is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Feliza has been in her business for 20 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Feliza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Feliza joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu pai enviando algum valor para despesas de casa. 	
Trabalha no Ministério do Interior como polícia de protecção, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (varões de ferro, cimento, chapas, areia, pedra e outro) para construir um aviário para a criação de frangos.
No futuro deseja iniciar com a criação de frangos de corte para aumentar a sua renda mensal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é aumentar a capacidade do seu negócio e criar mais postos de emprego para outros.
texts.en:
Narciso is married and the father of 5 children. He lives in his own home with his family and supports his father by sending some money for household expenses.

He works at the Department of the Interior as a security policeman and with this loan he intends to buy construction material (iron beams, cement, metal sheets, sand, stone and others) to build an aviary for breeding chickens.

In future he hopes to start breeding hens for slaughter so that he can increase his monthly income and to this end he commits to duly paying off this loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to increase the capacity of his business and create more jobs for other people.

loans.use: buy construction material (iron beams, cement, metal sheets, sand, stone and others)

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
Silvia, esta solicitando un nuevo prestamo, porque tiene la iniciativa de fortalecer el negocio, comprandose mercaderia para la tienda, como boquitas, gaseosas, dulces, pan, huevos, entre otros productos que son necesarios para poder variar sus productos y poder ofrecer a los clientes lo necesario un mejor servicio.
Su proposito es tener un negocio mas fuerte, que a traves de los prestamos lo esta logrando, pues el prestamo anterior le permitio realizar una buena inversion que hasta el momento le ha dado los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en:
Silvia is requesting another loan in order to strengthen her business. She’ll buy merchandise for her store, like chips, sodas, sweets, bread, eggs among other products that are needed to vary her offering and provide her clients with better service. 

Her goal is to have a stronger business, which she is accomplishing via the loans. Her previous loan provivede her with a good investment and has given her much needed earnings.

loans.use: buy chips, sodas, sweets, bread and eggs.

loans.name: Gaudance

texts.en:
Gaudence is 23 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have three children between 1 and 4. None of her children go to school because they are still young. 

She sells bananas and sorghum. 

She wants the loan to buy more bananas and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow for providing milk and to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Illimani Del Sur Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento Illimani Del Sur está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Ylis ella tiene 42  años y es casada con siete  hijos que tienen las edades de 22, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12 Y 10 años todos en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos de movilidad se dedica a esta actividad hace cinco años,  su domicilio  se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Ovejuyo,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ylis  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de repuestos por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo la Sra. Ylis enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando repuestos para su negocio y poder ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes y así  generar mayores ingresos,  La Sra. Ylis es una persona muy trabajadora saca delante a su familia, esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene, se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank "Illimani Del Sur" is made up of 8 members: six women and two men.  The president of the bank is Ylis.  She is 42 years old, and is married with 7 children aged 22, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, and 10.  Her children are all school aged.  She has a business selling spare parts for vehicles.  She has had this business for 5 years.  Her house is located in the town of Ovejuyo.  This loan is her second with the institution.  Ylis will use this loan to buy spare parts at wholesale.  The reason she is requesting the loan is that she lacks cash.  Ylis faces challenges in her business, including the competition.  She will use the profits to continue buying spare parts for her business, so that she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers and thereby generate more income.  Ylis is a person who works very hard to get ahead with her family.  This is her only business, and she feels happy for the opportunity that is being provided to her and her fellow group members, because for some of them, they are the sole support of their families.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in bulk

loans.name: Rafael

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 8 filhos dos quais 7 já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ele. 	
Trabalha como técnico agrário, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, barrotes, ferro, chapas de zinco e outros) para a cobertura da casa de banho e construção do seu muro.
No futuro pretende aumentar o seu nível profissional continuando com os estudos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é ter uma casa condigna e casar oficialmente.
texts.en:
Rafael is married and the father of 8 children, 7 fo whom are of age. He lives in his own house with his family and supports 2 grandchildren who live with him.

He works as an agrarian technician and with this loan he intends to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, beams, iron, zinc sheets and others) for the roof of his bathroom and the construction of his wall.

In future he intends to improve his professional qualifications by continuing with his studies,  and to this end he commits to duly paying off this loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to have the home his family deserve and to officially get married.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement, sand, beams, iron, zinc sheets and others)

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en:
Sanan is 27 years old and a passionate man. He is married and has three daughters. 

He has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last five years. His father was his best teacher who taught him how to look after land and raise organic crops. He is also working as a laborer. This job is not permanent, however, and the salary is very low.

Fruits and vegetables are very popular among Azerbaijani people and they use them in everyday meals. They use them fresh as well as cooked with meat (Dolma). His monthly income is 120 AZN and he usually sells his crop in the central bazaar.

He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and garden tools to improve the quality of his crop and increase his monthly turnover.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Munsuf

texts.en:
Munsuf is 54 years old and on a pension. He is married and has three children. 

He sells fruits such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates and bananas. With the help of AqroInvest CU, Munsuf was able to start his own business.  He has 15 years of experience and the reason to start his business was poor living conditions and a low pension.  

Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during the year. People like to eat them fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. His shop is located in the center bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruits. His monthly income from this business is 180 AZN. His elder son helps him to sell fruits.

Munsuf wants to expand his business because the amount of products he sells is not enough to cover high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover as well as improve the life of his family. For this purpose he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan. This will be his second loan and Munsuf has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 35 años, vive con su pareja en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago; María es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, ella siempre ha trabajado desde muy joven, tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar la carrera de Secretariado que tanto quería, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar vóley con sus amigos y vecinos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso “Arroz con Pato” para engreír a su pareja.
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y al apoyo de su pareja, desde hace más de 3 años, María puso en marcha una pequeña cevichería, donde vende ceviche y chilcano, ella y su pareja se levantan muy temprano para dejar todo preparado y listo para atender a sus comensales, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 7 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender a un promedio de 50 clientes; María cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a que es conocida y recomendada por sus clientes por su buena sazón y trato amable.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mesas, sillas y un toldo, de esta manera podrá contar con un negocio mejor acondicionado y podrá atender mayor cantidad de clientes e incrementará sus ingresos económicos, y así poco a poco espera ahorrar el dinero necesario para convertir su pequeño negocio en un buen restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria is a 35 year-old woman who lives with her partner in the city of Ica, in the Santiago district.  Maria is a very hardworking and enthusiastic woman.  She has always worked very hard, ever since she was very young.  She has a great desire to succeed.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to study to become a secretary, which she would have liked to have done.  But her dream is to be able to do this someday.  In her spare time, she enjoys playing volleyball with her friends and neighbors, and at times she enjoys cooking the delicious "arroz con pato" (rice with duck) to pamper her partner.

Thanks to her enterprising spirit and the support of her husband, Maria started up a small ceviche restaurant more than 3 years ago, where she sells ceviche and chilcano (a cocktail made with the Peruvian brandy called Pisco).  She and her husband get up very early to make all of the preparations and get ready to serve their customers.  She works in the business for about 7 hours a day, during which time she is able to serve about 50 customers.  Maria believes that her business is doing well because her business is well-known and is recommended by her customers because of the tasty food and friendly service.

Maria is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help that they are providing she will be able to purchase tables, chairs and a canopy, in this way better equipping her business so that she will be able to tend to a greater number of customers and increase her income.  This way, she hopes to gradually save enough money so that she can convert her small business into a good restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and a canopy

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 6 filhos todos ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É reformada no Ministério da Defesa, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (fechaduras, areia, ferro, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende melhor a sua casa e investir na educação dos filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é aumentar a sua receita desenvolvendo uma actividade comercial mais competitivo.
texts.en:
Alice is married with 6 children who are all still at School, lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She has retired from her job at the Ministry of Defense and with this loan she intends to buy construction materials (locks, sand, iron, cement and others) so that she can continue the work on her house.

In future she intends to improve her house and invest in the education of her children, to which end she commits to duly paying off this loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to increase her income by developing a more competitive commercial activity.

loans.use: buy construction materials (locks, sand, iron, cement and others)

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: Alba, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y  los dos hijos  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar la semilla de café para hacer un almacigo y además comprar insumos como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella tiene pensado comprar todos estos insumos para poder darle la asistencia adecuada al almacigo y así tenerlo en las condiciones más optimas y poder venderlo en la localidad y lugares aledaños y  así  generar  ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Alba is 30 years old, she is married and she lives with her husband and their two children. She wants to invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of coffee seeds in order to start a seedling bed, and also to buy supplies such as manure and fumigation and to pay for laborers. She has thought about buying all these supplies to provide good care to her seedling bed, in order to keep it in the best conditions to then sell her product in her community and in the neighboring villages; she aims at earning a good income to reach a better standard of living as well as economic stability. This is the first loan she receives from FUDECOSUR. She hadn’t had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy coffee seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos todos ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É professora e quadro do Ministério da Educação, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, chapas de zinco, barrotes, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa e ingressar a faculdade, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de material de construção, assim vem fazendo a sua obra em partes.
texts.en:
Elisa is single and the mother of 2 children who are still at School, lives in her own house with her children and doesn't support anyone else.

She is a teacher and has tenure with the Ministry of Education. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (iron, zinc sheets, beam, cement and others) to continue the work on her house.

In future she hopes to finish the construction of her house and enroll in university, to which end she commits to duly paying off this loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the high cost of construction materials and as such she carries out her construction work in sections.

loans.use: buy construction materials (iron, zinc sheets, beam, cement and others)

loans.name: Utulivi Group

texts.en: Abdala is in his late 30s, married and the father of two children, one of whom attends school. For the last 12 years, he has earned a living by running a tailor shop. He works from 8:00 a m  to 8:30 p.m. daily and makes a fair monthly profit. He is requesting his fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to buy supplies for his business and pay his household expenses. He has successfully repaid all of his loans and is applying for a new loan to buy sewing equipment to make more dresses to sell to his customers. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house. He will share this loan with his group, "Utulivi," which has 15 members, all of whom hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing equipment to make more dresses to sell.

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 65 años de  edad, es casada y no cuenta con hijos dependientes. Vive junto a su esposo en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, ubicado en la región Piura.

Se dedica desde hace más de 15 años a la crianza y venta de animales. Ella cría ovejas y aves de corral en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su vivienda. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y negociantes de la zona, debido al tiempo que lleva laborando cuenta con una clientela establecida. Su esposo es agricultor y juntos mantienen la economía de su familia.

Angélica desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales y también desea mejorar sus animales, de modo que su negocio produzca mejores ganancias. Para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante luchadora y trabajadora. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y bastante amable. Angélica agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán con este préstamo.
texts.en:
Angelica is 65 years old, married, and has no dependent children.  She lives with her husband in one of the rural settlements that is found in this rural farming district of Tambogrande, located in the Piura region.

Angelica has been raising and selling animals for more than 15 years.  She raises sheep and poultry in corrals located in the back of her house.  She feeds them grains and pasture grass, and when they reach a good level of development she offers them for sale to her neighbors and to the traders in the area.  Because she's been doing this so long, she has an established customer base.  Her husband is a farmer, and together they support the family finances.

Angelica wants to buy some nutritionally balanced feed for her animals, and she also wants to improve her animals so that her business produces better earnings.  To do this, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  

Angelica is a very hardworking and tenacious woman.  The people who know her consider her to be a tranquil and quite friendly woman.  Angelica thanks in advance the people who will support her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, and to make some repairs to her corrals to improve her business raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos todos ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É polícia do Ministério do Interior e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, chapas de zinco, barrotes, cimento, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja continuar com os seus estudos e apostar na educação dos seus filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é terminar a sua obra e ingressar no mundo comercial.
texts.en:
Virgilio is married and the father of 4 children who all still attend School, lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He is a policeman with the Department of the Interior and with this loan he plans to purchase construction materials (iron, zinc sheets, beams, cement, stone and others) to continue to the work on his house.

In future he intends to continue with his own studies and invest in his children's education, to which end he commits to duly paying off his loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to finish his construction work and to enter the commercial world.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, zinc sheets, beams, cement, stone and others)

loans.name: Rabeca

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 4 ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu neto que vive com ela. 	
É comerciante vende produtos de primeira necessidade e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (janelas, ferro, chapas de zinco, barrotes, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa e aumentar a capacidade do seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a baixa da sua receita porque já não da para a sua alimentação e ao mesmo tempo continuar com a obra.
texts.en:
Rabeca is single and the mother of 5 children, 4 of whom still attend School. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her grandson who lives with her.

She is a trader selling essential goods and with this loan she plans to buy construction materials (windows, iron, zinc sheets, beams and others) to continue the work on her house.

In future she intends to complete her house and increase the capacity of her business, to which end she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is her low income which is no longer enough for her food and to at the same time continue with the construction work.

loans.use: buy construction materials (windows, iron, zinc sheets, beams and others)

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга – замужем. Она живет в Каменке большую часть своей жизни. В преимущественно сельскохозяйственном регионе страны мало вариантов для трудоустройства. Большая часть населения занимается фермерским делом. Ольга же решила посвятить себя торговле сельскохозяйственными товарами: семенами, сельхозхимией, пленкой для теплиц и т.д. В этом бизнесе Ольге всячески помогает супруг. У них с мужем три точки для торговли: одна в Знаменке, 2 – в Каменке. Ольга занимается этим бизнесом уже 11 лет. Ее ежемесячный оборот с одной точки на данный момент составляет около 70 000 гривен. 

Ольга обратилась в КИВА за кредитом в размере 20 000 гривен в надежде вложить полученные средства в закупку партии сельхозтовара, а именно приобрести семена и удобрения для последующей реализации. Закупка сезонного товара позволит Ольге увеличить оборот и получить дополнительную прибыль, тем самым предоставив возможность еще больше развивать свой бизнес. Ольга не хочет останавливаться на достигнутом и планирует в дальнейшем расширяться и торговать мототехникой, минитракторами и т.п. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Olga is married. She has been living in Kamenka for most of her life. In this primarily agricultural region of the country there are few employment opportunities. Most people in the region do farm work. Olga decided to focus on selling  farm supplies: seeds, chemicals, plastic film for hothouses, etc.. Olga’s husband helps her in this business in every way. She and her husband have three sales points: one in Znamenka and two and Kamenka. Olga has been in this business for 11 years already. Her monthly sales volume from one sales point is presently around 70,000 UAH.

Olga has turned to Kiva for a loan in the amount of 20,000 in the hope to invest these funds into stocking up on agricultural supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers, for later resale. Buying seasonal supplies will allow Olga to increase her sales volume and earn an additional income, allowing her to continue growing her business. Olga does not want to stop there, and plans in the future to expand her business and sell agricultural machinery, mini-tractors etc.
Note: this case description is in Russian.

loans.use: to stock up on farm  supplies, particularly seeds and fertilizers, for later resale.

loans.name: 71-Las Preciosas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 71- Las Preciosas está  compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un varón la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Arminda ella tiene 34  años y es casada con cuatro hijos que tienen las edades de 16, 8, 5 Y 3 años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo ofrece en distintas barrios y oficinas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  su domicilio  se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de la Guardia,   este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Arminda  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de cosméticos por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo la Sra. Arminda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos para su negocio y poder ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes y así  generar mayores ingresos,  La Sra. Arminda es una persona muy trabajadora saca delante a su familia, esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene, se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The Communal Bank “71-Las Preciosas” is formed by 9 members, 8 females and 1 male. The Bank’s president is Arminda. She is 34 years old and married with 4 children of the ages 16, 8, 5 and 3. She sells cosmetics by catalogue to different neighborhoods and offices in the city of Santa Cruz. She lives in the area of Guardia. This is her 3rd loan cycle with the institution. Arminda will use this loan to buy wholesale cosmetics, as her reason to solicit this loan is because she needs capital to invest. The challenge Arminda faces in her business is competition and so she will use the loan to continue buying cosmetics so she can offer her clients a variety of different products and that way generate more income. Arminda is a hard-working woman who gets her family ahead. This is the only job that she maintains. She is happy for the opportunity offered to her and the members of the group, as in some cases, they are the only ones who maintain their families.

loans.use: buy wholesale cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, vive con su esposa  y tres hijos, de 14, 11, 8 años de edad, el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 15 años, trabaja todos los días desde las 6:00am hasta las 3:00pm atendiendo lo que demande la siembra.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas, para aplicarlos al cultivo, ayudando así a preparar de mejor manera el terreno, buscando la oportunidad de mejorar cada vez la producción de maíz y frijol.
La aspiración de José es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, además de mantenerse firme en sus actividades para poder asegurarse la alimentación para su hogar.
texts.en:
José makes a living by cultivating corn and beans. He lives with his wife and three children who are 14, 11, and 8 years old. He has worked in this career for 15 years, and every day he works from 6am until 3pm, attending to the needs of the season.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides to use on his fields, helping to better prepare the land in the hopes of increasing his corn and bean production. 

José wants to support his children with school, in addition to remaining steady with his work in order to assure that his family has food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grass for cattle and supplies for planting.

loans.name: Mirna Isabel

texts.es:
Mirna, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el chalet, comprándose más golosinas, jugos, boquitas, aceite, pan, papas, que son demandados a diario por sus clientes, esto le ayudara a que Maria fortalezca el negocio y pueda seguir mejorando su condición.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, ya que realizo una buena inversión al negocio, su familia se mantiene en numero, pero sus condiciones han mejorado, debido a un incremento en las ventas ya que además incluyo la venta de enchiladas.
texts.en:
Mirna is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her store.  She will buy more candy, juices, snacks, cooking oil, bread, and potatoes, which are demanded daily by her customers.  This will help Maria to strengthen her business so that she can keep it in good condition.  

She saw a positive effect from her previous loan, because she made a good investment in her business.  Her family remains the same size, but their conditions have improved, thanks to her increase in sales, and also her sales of enchiladas.

loans.use: to buy candy, juices, snacks, cooking oil, bread and potatoes

loans.name: Maria Yamileth

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para mejorar el inventario de sus materiales pues comprara al mayor lo que es leña, maíz, gas y otros, que son los necesarios para seguir mejorando la atención a los clientes.
Ella considera que con el préstamo anterior logro mantener sus ventas y pudo seguir generando las ganancias para su familia, que hasta el momento se encuentra muy bien.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan to stock up her inventory by buying firewood, corn, gas and other items she needs to keep on improving the service she offers to her customers.
She says that thanks to her previous loan she succeeded in maintaining her level of sales and was able to earn money for her family, that up to now is doing very well.

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn and gas.

loans.name: Gracio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos 1 ainda frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe que vive com ele.	
É operador de ponte rolante, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, barrotes, cimento, pedra, areia e outros) para concluir a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja terminar o curso que esta a seguir, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é terminar a sua obra e melhorar na sua carreira profissional.
texts.en:
Gracio is married and the father of 2 children, 1 of whom still attends School. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his mother who lives with him.

He operates a crane for a living and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, beams, cement, stone, sand and others) to complete the construction work on his house.

In future he hopes to finish the degree he is currently taking, to which end he commits to duly paying off his loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to finish his construction work and improve his professional career.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, beams, cement, stone, sand and others)

loans.name: Reselia

texts.pt:
Divorciada e mãe de 5 filhos 1 ainda frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua irmã que vive com ela.	
É comerciante vende roupa diversa, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar fardos de roupa (cortinas, mantas, duvetes e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja mobilar a sua casa e oferecer mais conforto a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é construir um estabelecimento comercial e aumentar a sua mercadoria para responder a demanda da sua clientela.
texts.en:
Reselia is divorced and the mother of 5 children, 1 of whom still goes to School. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her sister who lives with her.

She is a trader selling various types of clothing and with this loan she plans to buy bundles of clothing (curtains, blankets, duvets and others) to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

In future she would like to furnish her house and offer her family more comfort, to which end she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to build a commercial establishment and increase her stock so that she can keep up with the demand of her clientele.

loans.use: buy bundles of clothing (curtains, blankets, duvets and others) to increase the quantity of her merchandise

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristino, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras, como manzanas, uvas, fresas, plátanos, papas, tomates, cebollas, para poder surtir el negocio de frutos frescos,  esto le ayudara para seguir ofreciendo a los clientes lo necesario. 
El préstamo anterior le permitió mejorar el negocio y cubrir la demanda en otras zonas, esto mismo le garantiza que sus ingresos han sido tambien mejor para su hogar.
texts.en: Cristino is requesting a new loan to be able to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables, such as apples, grapes, strawberries, bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, and onions, to be able to stock his fresh fruits business. This will help him continue offering his clients what they need. The previous loan allowed him to improve his business and meet the demand in other areas. The loan guarantees that his income has also been better for his family.

loans.use: Purchase apples, grapes, strawberries, bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando un préstamo para dar inicio a la siembra de esta temporada, pues cultivara con su familia maíz, tambien invertirá una parte del dinero en la sastrería, específicamente se comprara abono, limpiar el terreno, herbicidas, para la sastrería comprara telas, ciper, mantenimiento de las maquinas de coser.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a mantener una maquina en buenas condiciones, dándole mantenimiento, y se compro tela para confeccionar uniformes, su núcleo familiar se mantiene sus ingresos si han mejorado.
texts.en:
Rosa is requesting a loan to start up the this season's planting. She will farm corn with her family.  She will also invest part of the money in tailoring. Specifically, she will buy fertilizer and herbicides and clean the land. For tailoring, she will buy fabrics, zippers and sewing machine maintenance.

She considers that the previous loan helped her to maintain a machine and keep it in good condition. She also bought fabric to make uniforms. Her immediate family is supported and her income has improved.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, zippers and sewing machine maintenance

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: jacqueline est une jeune femme de 35 ans célibataire, mère d'un enfant agé de 16 ans  qui va à l'école, elle a aussi 2 autres personnes à sa charge. elle est commerçante depuis 20 ans déjà dans un marché de la place ou elle commercialise le couscous (manioc et maïs) la tomate selon les saisons. elle a de l'expérience en la matière et se debrouille assez bien. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour se déplacer et allez acheter sa marchandise à des prix bas et en grande quantité dans les villages. Ce qui lui permettra d'agrandir son activité et surtout de réaliser un bon bénéfice. profit qui l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d'épargner pour les besoins futurs comme la scolarité.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a young woman, 35 years old, unmarried, and a mother of a 16-year-old child, who goes to school. She also has two other persons to support. Jacqueline has been a merchant for twenty years already at a local market, where she sells couscous (of cassava or corn) and tomatoes in season. She has some experience in this area and manages to get by fairly well. 

Jacqueline is requesting a loan for transportation purposes and is going to purchase her merchandise at low prices and in large amounts from the villages. This will enable her to expand her business and especially to make a good profit. 

The profits will help her to meet the needs of her family and to save money for future needs, such as education.

loans.use: to travel through the countryside (to buy foodstuff)

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 4 filhos a mais velha já casada e o mais novo continua com os estudos. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Trabalha na Associação agrícola Pfucane como agricultor, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar uma charrua de tractor para as lavouras.
No futuro pretende aumentar as suas áreas de produção para poder obter mais rendimento, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir uma viatura para escoar a sua produção.
texts.en:
Elisa is a widow and the mother of 4 children, the oldest of whom is already married and the youngest is continuing his studies. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She works at the Associação Agrícola Pfucane (Agricultural Association) as farmer and with this loan she plans to purchase a plow for her tractor to use in her farming.

In future she intends to increase her farming area to be able to obtain more income, to which end she commits to duly paying off this loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to purchase a vehicle to drain off her produce.

loans.use: to purchase a plow for her tractor to use in her farming

loans.name: Nila Genny

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Nila. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  tres hijos ya todos son mayares de edad, uno  de ellos viven aun con ella ya que sufre de ataques de epilepsia. Su marido trabaja en Guayaquil.
