Nuestra amiga para ganar sus propios ingresos y con estos poder contribuir con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella recorre con sus productos los mismos que entrega ya que la mayor parte son pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación, trabaja cuatro días de la semana, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días o los fines de semana de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes, su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil ya que aprovecha los viajes de su esposo para ir a comprar por lo general los fines de mes. Lleva más de 12 años con su negocio el cual le deja buenas satisfacciones.

Este crédito es para ir a comprar ropa en Guayaquil ya que tiene algunos pedidos. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución.
 
Sus sueños son ver que su hijo se recupere de ese mal que lo aqueja y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The La Sequita communal bank meets in the Sequita parish, which belongs to the region of Montecristi and the village of Manabita. It is full of dedicated, hard-working people who are proud of their roots and heritage. Sequita is a parish where the residents are honest people who only know how to work and take care of their families. 

Nila lives here. She is 45 years old, married and has three adult children. One of these children lives with her, due to suffering from epilepsy. Her husband works in Guayaquil.

Our friend sells all types of clothes in order to earn her own income and contribute to household expenses. Her form of sale is door-to-door, she travels with the products that she delivers. The majority are orders made in advance by customers who pay on credit, which Nila collects every 15 days or on the weekends, according to her customers' wishes. She works four days a week. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil, taking advantage of her husband's trips to go and buy at the end of the month, generally. She has worked in this business for over 12 years and is satisfied with it.

This loan is to buy clothes in Guayaquil since she already has some orders. She is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because of the additional benefits that the institution provides.

Her dreams are to see her son recover from the severe back pain he suffers from, and to continue working.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam comes from Mitan-ag, Bonifacio. She is 49 years old. Meriam is married and has five children. To make a living, Meriam cultivates coconuts for sale. Meriam has been in this business for 14 years and earns 4,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Meriam joined GDMPC. Meriam is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Barbare Charlotte

texts.fr: Charlotte est une femme de 55 ans veuve, mère de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 8 et et 23 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place où elle vend des vivres frais et secs selon les saisons et aussi des poissons fumés et harengs depuis 5 ans déjà. cette activité fonctionne à merveille c'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter en grandes quantité ses harengs et poissons fumés ce qui permettra d'augmenter de fonds de commerce, d'éviter les ruptures de stocks qu'elle rencontre souvent et surtout de réaliser un plus gros bénéfice. Profit qui l'aidera à économiser pour la scolarité de ses ses trois enfants et de ses deux petits fils et de subvenir aux besoins quotidien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Charlotte is a 55-year-old woman, a widow, and a mother of six children, from 8 to 23 years old. Three of her children still go to school. She is a merchandise at a local market, where she has for five years been selling fresh and dried foodstuffs in season and also smoked fish and herrings. 

This business is going wonderfully, so this is why she is requesting this loan to purchase herrings and smoked fish in large amounts. This will enable her to increase her business capital, to avoid the inventory shortages which she often encounters, and especially to make a bigger profit. 

The profits will help Charlotte to save money for her children's education and that of her two grandsons, as well as to meet the day-to-day needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is from Garang, Tangub City. She is 40 years old. Elena is married and has two children. To make a living, Elena sells pork products in the local community. Elena has been in this business for two years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined GDMPC. Elena is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more pork to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more pork to sell.

loans.name: Emelyane

texts.en: Emelyane is age 30. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past 6 years. With this loan she wants to add shoes to her business so that she can sell both clothes and shoes. She plans to use the profits for renovating her house.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Justa Rufina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Justa, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, todos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos estudia en colegio y todos sus hijos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, nos cuenta que su esposo sale todos los días desde muy temprano a la ciudad de Portoviejo a proveerse de los mejores productos que encuentra en los mercados mayoristas,  luego en su carro recorrer por toda la localidad y sitios cercanos, también recorre por los campos para comprar directamente de los agricultores y lo que le hace falta lo compra en el mercado. Lleva más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y con esto ellos han salido adelante.

Este crédito es para surtirse de frutas y legumbres. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para poder ayudar a sus esposo en sus negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
Communal Bank La Sequita members meet at the Sequita parish that belongs to Montecristi, of the prosperous Manabi province, full of hard working people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish of honest people who spend their time working and caring for their families. 

We met Justa, 45, here. She is married with four children, all of them above 18. The youngest still attends school and all of them still live with her. Her husband is a driver. 

Our friend is asking for a loan for her husband's grocery business. She says he leaves early every morning to Portoviejo City in order to purchase the best products at wholesale markets. He then drives around the community and surrounding places, as well as the fields in order to purchase directly from farmers. Whatever he misses he buys in the market. He has been doing this for more than 10 years and this has been their family's livelihood. 

This loan is aimed at purchasing fruits and vegetables. Justa has been a member since the beginning of her Communal Bank and she likes it because of the support she receives to be able to help her husband's business. 

Her dream is to own a grocery shop.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is a 47-year-old man who is married and has three children. He sells fruit, such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates and bananas. With the help of AqroInvest CU, Elchin was able to start his own business. He has 10 years of experience and the reason he started his business was poor living conditions and unemployment.  

Fruit is very popular among Azerbaijani people and in high demand during year. People like to eat fresh fruit, and this is one of the main desserts for guests. His shop is in the center of the bazaar and people always pass his shop and come in to buy some fresh fruit. His monthly income from this business is 200 AZN. Elchin's son helps him sell his fruit.

Elchin wants to expand his business. He does not have enough stock to meet the high demand. He would like to buy more fruit and vegetables and increase his turnover as well as improve life of his family. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. This will be his second loan and Elchin has good client history.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Francisco Arturo

texts.es:
Francisco, quiere seguir creciendo en el negocio, por eso esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mariscos como pescado, jaibas, camarones y otros que sean frescos y que sean de la preferencia de los clientes.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ha permitido mejorar su negocio, incrementar sus ventas y que su familia este en mejores condiciones, y el ha expandido la ruta de venta.
texts.en:
Francisco wants his activity to keep on growing, and for this reason he is requesting a loan to buy seafood such as fish, crabs and shrimps among others seafood that is fresh and that meet the customers' requests.
He says his previous loan has helped him in improving his activity, in increasing his sales and in offering a better standard of living to his family; on top pf this, he has expanded his sales channels.

loans.use: To buy fish, crabs and shrimps.

loans.name: Sara Esmeralda

texts.es:
Sara, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, pues quiere comprarse productos de primera necesidad para el negocio, comprándose aceite, pastas, papel higiénico, granos básicos, condimentos, jabón y detergentes. 
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho, pues considera que la variedad en el negocio aumento, dándole mayores oportunidades para las ventas a los clientes, sus ingresos tambien le han mejorando, dándole una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sara has decided to ask for a new loan because she wants to stock up her shop with basic necessities such as oil, pastas, toilet paper, basic grains, dressings, soap and detergents.
She says her previous loan has been of great help for her, because she was able to increase the variety of her inventory, therefore offering a wider variety of products to her customers. Her income has consequently increased and this in its turn has contributed to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy oil, pastas, toilet paper, basic grains, dressings, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 27 years old. She sells different foodstuffs in her store. With this loan she wants to buy beans, sorghum, and rice for resale. She wants to use the profits to build a store for her business and to buy a cow to provide milk for the family.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and beans for resale.

loans.name: Vusale

texts.en:
Vusale is a 34-year-old woman, who is married and has four children. She is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods, such as flour, beverages, macaronis, butter, and candies. She has 10 years of experience and has a deep knowledge of the market and the demands of her clients.
 
The food products she sells are very popular and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling food is 130 AZN. Her husband helps buy stock and bring it to the shop. This is the sole financial income for her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location in the central bazaar of her home city.

She has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to buy more food products and diversify the range of goods she offers to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is married, has two children and earns a living by selling groceries. She has been in this business for two years and now employs has one person. She has grown her small company since joining Faulu Kenya because of the training she has received on management skills. She hopes to grow her business, and is requesting a loan for 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tomatoes, cabbage and bananas.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage and bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Julienne Evelyne

texts.fr: Julienne est une jeune femme de 39 ans mariée mère de 6 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 8 et 23 ans et tous vont à l'école. Elle a une petite alimentation ou elle fait un petit commerce général(tomate, oignon, savon, huiles ...etc) près de son domicile depuis 10 ans déjà.Son activité fonctionne à merveille mais ne rapporte pas assez parce qu'elle achète tout le temps et en détail . ce crédit l'aidera à augmenter les stocks des marchandises en achetant en cartons et des bidons d'huile raffinée et de palme ce qui lui permettra de réaliser un plus gros profit. Bénéfice qui permettra d'aider son époux avec certains besoin quotidiens et économiser pour la scolarisation de leurs enfants, et agrandir son activité dans un avenir proche
texts.en:
Julienne is a young woman, 39 years old, and a  mother of six children, from 8 to 23 years old. All the children are in school. Julienne has a small grocery store, where she has been doing  small-scale commerce in general (tomatoes, onions, soap, oil… etc.) near her home for ten years already. Her business is going wonderfully but doesn't bring in enough because she always makes her purchases retail. This loan will help her to increase her stock of merchandise through the purchase of drums of refined palm oil, which will enable her to make a bigger profit.

The profits will enable Julienne to help out her husband in covering certain day-to-day expenses and to save money for their children's education, as well as to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Nacaf

texts.en:
Nacaf is 58-year-old man who is married with four children. He raises and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables like pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates, bananas, onions, potatoes, cabbage, etc. Nacaf has 10 years of experience in this field and has gained the necessary skills and knowledge required for his business. 

Fruit is very popular among Azerbaijani people and in high demand during the year. People like to eat it fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. His shop is located in the center bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruit. His monthly income from this business is AZN 180. Nacaf's wife helps him to sell fruit.

Nacaf wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase seeds and fertilizers to increase his turnover as well as to improve the life of his family. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of AZN 1,000.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 44 years old and has earned a living for the last 12 years by selling foodstuffs. She is requesting this loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to buy a cow to provide milk and set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Avelina

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 55 años que vive con su esposa e hijo en la parroquia de "Pacto" del cantón "Quito" donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador. Esta parroquia rural se encuentra a dos horas de Quito acercándose a la región costa del país. En esta región la flora y fauna son sus principales características, la mayoría de habitantes se dedica a actividades agrícolas o ganaderas.

María se dedica a la crianza de pollos para luego venderlos desde hace 5 años; esta actividad la aprendió de su familia y ahora le sirve para sustentar su propio hogar. Esta mujer emprendedora desea construir un galpón para la crianza de sus pollos y de esta manera puedan tener un lugar donde estén libres de robos y de comer cualquier alimento que puedan encontrar en el suelo; con esto también se le facilitará la limpieza e higiene del sitio. Para lograr esto requiere un crédito, el cual podrá ayudarle a mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman of 55 who lives with her husband and son in the Pacto parish in the canton of Quito, where the capital of Ecuador is located. This rural parish is located two hours from Quito, going closer to the coastal region of the country. The flora and fauna are the principal features in this region. The majority of the residents work in agricultural or livestock-related activities.

Maria has been raising chickens to sell for five years. She learned this business from her family, and now it serves to sustain her own household. This entrepreneurial woman wants to construct a shed for raising her chickens, and in this way they will be able to have a space where they are free from theft and from eating any food that they find on the ground. This will also facilitate the cleaning and hygiene of the site. To achieve this she needs a loan, which will help her improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to make a little shed for the chickens that she raises

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia Elsa nació en la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente ella  vive en la comunidad de Huchuy Qosqo de la provincia de Calca, 

La socia Elsa se sigue dedicando a la venta de verduras como por ejemplo zanahoria, tomates, cebollas y otras verduras más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Elsa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras como por ejemplo tomates, cebollas, repollos, lechugas, zanahorias y otros más. La socia Elsa sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Huchuy Qosqo” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
The member, Elsa, was born in Calca province in the department of Cusco. Now, she lives in Huchuy Qosqo in Calca province. 

Elsa continues to sell vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, onions and others. She has been in this business for many years. She does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Elsa needs a loan in order to purchase vegetables like tomatoes, onions, cabbage, lettuce, carrots and others. She belongs to the “Huchuy Qosqo” communal bank which is a part of the in the Asociación Arariwa in city of Cusco.

loans.use: purchase vegetables like tomatoes, onions, cabbage, lettuce, carrots and others.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona productora de mango y limón que se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura. La mayor parte de esos centros poblados tienen una condición de vida bastante precaria y no cuentan con servicios básicos.

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza de cabras y aves de corral, ella ya tiene más de cuatro años de experiencia, actualmente cuenta con veinticinco cabras y otro tanto de aves de corral. La crianza es compartida por ella y su esposo, los cuales siempre se apoyan mutuamente. Ella cuenta con conocimientos de una adecuada alimentación de los animales. Una vez que se han desarrollado completamente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona en donde reside. 

Cristina desea adquirir alimento balanceado para engordar a sus animales y asimismo desea realizar mejoras en el corral de los mismos. Esto ayudara a poder comercializarlos en un buen precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 41 year-old mother who lives with her husband and their three children in one of the rural settlements that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  In this area, in the Piura region, mangoes and lemons are grown.  In most of the towns in this area people live in conditions that are quite poor, and they live without basic utilities like water or electricity.

Cristina has a business raising goats and poultry.  She already has more than 4 years of experience with this business, and she now has 25 goats and numerous barnyard fowl.  She raises the animals along with her husband; they always provide each other with mutual support.  She has knowledge of how to appropriately feed her animals.  Once the animals are completely developed, she offers them for sale to the traders in the area where she lives.

Cristina wants to acquire nutritionally balanced feed to fatten her animals, and she also wants to make some repairs to the corrals where she houses them.  This will help her to be able to sell the animals at a good price.  In order to achieve this objective, she has requested a loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed to fatten her animals, and to make some repairs to her corrals

loans.name: Namiq

texts.en: Namiq is 41 years old, married and the father of two children. He is a very kind, hardworking and passionate man who earns a living by selling crops such as tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, carrots and potatoes. He also raises fruits such as apples, pears and pomegranates. After finishing school, he went into business as a farmer and now has three years of experience in this field. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand in his area because people like to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Namiq usually sells his produce in his town's central bazaar and earns about 180 AZN a month. Unfortunately, this is not enough money to meet his family's needs, even though his wife adds to the family income by working as a teacher. To improve his business, Namiq is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN to buy garden tools, fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to buy garden tools, fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 51 years old and lives in Mantic Tangub City with her husband and three children. She used her last loan to buy new items to sell to her customers and expand her product offerings. She is requesting this new loan to buy more items to sell. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ligia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Muchos productos variados que exhibe en un estante son los que ofrece a sus clientes, un frízer que utiliza para mantener sus productos frescos y una frutera donde ubica sus verduras son los materiales de trabajo de la señora Ligia habitante de Granada, de 48 años de edad de los cuales 2 años y medio le ha dedicado a su negocio de pulpería, casada, madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad que viven independientes. Ella realizo estudios hasta la primaria porque su situación económica le impidió seguir, pero eso no detuvo a Ligia pues lucho para salir adelante, ahora tiene su propio negocio pero con eso no se conformo también se dedica a la venta de comida. Ella inicio su actividad vendiendo frescos y comida en pocas cantidades, luego con el tiempo fue obteniendo clientes que quedaron satisfechos con los platillos que elabora Ligia, ella de las ganancias que sacaba iba invirtiendo en su pulpería hasta hacerla mas sostenible, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de sus hijos, sus productos los comercializa en su casa de habitación.

Ella se levanta desde muy temprano para poner su negocio en marcha, su esposo le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que trabaja de sastre además cuida una finca que esta cerca de la comunidad. Ligia solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jugos, gaseosa jabón, café, carne y verduras, ella dice que el préstamo será de ayuda porque podrá seguir con su negocio ofreciendo más variedades de productos  para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes obteniendo mayores ventas que le generaran más ganancias, sus planes futuros es cancelar el crédito y requerir un nuevo crédito para comprar otro frízer ya que su objetivo es cumplir su sueños de salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
A stand that displays a wide variety of products that she offers to her customers, a freezer that she uses to keep her products fresh, and a fruit bowl that contains her vegetables are Ligia’s working materials.  Ligia lives in Granada, she is 48 years old, and has dedicated two and a half years to her general store.  She is married and the mother of three children who live on their own.  She attended school up to the primary level but her economic situation prevented her from continuing.  However, this did not stop Ligia from striving to get ahead.  Now she has her own business but she did not settle for this; she also sells meals.  She began this activity selling fruit drinks and small quantities of food.  Then over time she was getting customers who were satisfied with the dishes she prepared.  She took the profits and invested in her general store to make it more sustainable.  Her children help her in the business and she sells her products from her home.

She rises very early to get her business going.  Her husband helps her with the household expenses working as a tailor and tending a farm located near their community.  Ligia is requesting the loan to purchase staples such as rice, beans, sugar, juice, soda, ham, coffee, meat, and vegetables.  She says the loan will be helpful enabling her to continue sustaining her business by offering a wider variety of products to satisfy customer needs and increase sales, which will generate more profits.  Her future plan is to pay off the loan and request a new loan to purchase another freezer. Her goal is to fulfill her dream of helping her family get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase staples such as rice, beans, sugar, juice, soda, ham, coffee, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat is a 38-year-old man, and he is married with two sons. He raises and sells fruits such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates, and bananas. Nemat has 8 years of experience in this field and gained the necessary skills and knowledge required for his business. He also works as a laborer and participates in construction; however, this job is not permanent and brings low income.

Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand throughout the year. People like to eat them fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. Nemat's shop is located in the center bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruits. His monthly income from this business is 100 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN). 

Nemat wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase seeds and fertilizers to increase his turnover as well as to improve life of his family. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia used her previous loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy cereals for resale. With the additional stock, she made good profits. She used the additional income from the business to boost her grocery business. She hopes to grow the grocery business in the future. She has requested for another loan of KES 80,000 to buy cereals and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy cereals and vegetables

loans.name: 71-Las Americas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 71-Las Américas está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Beatriz ella tiene 24  años y es soltera con un  hijo que tiene las edad de un año ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo ofrece sus productos en distintos barrio y oficinas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  su domicilio  se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Limoncito,   este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Beatriz  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de cosméticos por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo la Sra. Beatriz enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando cosméticos para su negocio y poder ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes y así  generar mayores ingresos,  La Sra. Beatriz es una persona muy trabajadora saca delante a su familia, esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene, se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The entrepreneur bank, “71-Las Américas” is made up of eight members, seven women and one gentleman.  Beatriz is the bank’s president and she is 24 years old and single.  Her son is a year old.  She sells cosmetics through a catalog and offers her products in different neighborhoods in Santa Cruz.  Her home is located in Limoncito.  This will be her fifth loan through the institution.  Beatriz will use the money to buy cosmetics in quantity.  She is requesting this loan because she doesn’t have the capital.  She has challenges in her business, such as competition and she will use these benefits to continue buying cosmetics for her business and be able to offer a variety of products to her customers and in this way generate more income.  Beatriz is a hardworking person who supports and moves her family ahead though this, her only business activity.  She is happy about this opportunity given to her and to her fellow members, who in some cases also support their families on their own.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 33 years old. She is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She sells beverages and snacks. She has been in the business for the past ten years. With the loan, she wants to buy a refrigerator to cool beverages. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more milk and cooked cassava to sell.

loans.name: Qara

texts.en:
Qara is a 54-year-old man who is married with two children. He is a farmer who has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 18 years. Over the years, Qara gained enough skills and experience to run a business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made with vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every family's table in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch. Qara usually sells his crops in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 160 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Qara wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is a married woman with 5 children. Emelyn is 36 years old and she resodes at Sta. Maria, Tangub, Philippines. Emelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 7,000.00 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 20,000.00 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Emelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Emelyn wants to build house and to enable her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 40 years old, married, and has two children. He sells clothes to earn a living. He has been in the business for seven years. He has employed three people in the business. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills.  
He hopes to grow his business and employ more people. He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Prende

texts.en:
Prende is married with five children. The oldest one is 26 and the youngest is six years old. Her family lives in the Northwest Albania and has been mainly involved in the livestock business. They currently own four cows and sell their milk to dairy producers in the region. They had saved a little money from their business profit; however, since one of their parents recently suffered major health problems, they spent it on him.
This is Prende’s second time applying for a loan. Her previous loan was successfully paid in full. She wants to repair a primitive stable that has been damaged from weather conditions. Note here that she is a responsible individual and her referrals have spoken very highly of her. 
She is thankful for the opportunity given to her to have her profile on Kiva to raise funds.

loans.use: to repair a damaged stable.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 35 years old. She sells different items in a boutique. She wants the loan to add more items such as soaps, rice, and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the rental charges for where she conducts her business.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, rice, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ian Orlando

texts.en:
Ian Orlando is married with five children. He is 30 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela.

Ian Orlando is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional fertilizers, such as inorganic and commercial. 

Ian Orlando has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, he hopes to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, such as inorganic and commercial

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Esperanza” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; repostería, bazar, almacén, venta de muebles, venta de comida rápida, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Rayner, presidente del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentado en primera fila ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste con jeans de color azul, chaqueta de color gris y lleva puesto un gorro en su cabeza. 
El se dedica al rubro de bazar de servicios varios como fotocopiadora, copias de llaves, reparación de celulares entre otros, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 5 meses, comenta que trabaja solo y que atiende de lunes a sábado, y su negocio lo ubica en  su casa.
Con el crédito Comprará insumos como papeles, artículos de regalo, articulos de escritorio y toner  para abastecer su negocio.
Sus metas son crecer día a día en su negocio y abastecerlo de gran variedad en mercadería para atraer más clientela, y con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Rayner vive junto a su esposa y 2 hijas quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijas para que el día de mañana sean grandes profesionales.
Rayner está muy contento y agradecido del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómodo con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad. Respecto  a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau
texts.en:
Story of the Communal Bank

“Esperanza” (Hope) is the name of this communal bank.  It is comprised of 18 entrepreneurs, who devote themselves to different trades such as baking, a bazaar or variety type store, grocery store, selling furniture, selling fast food, and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Chillan.

Rayner is the president of the group.  In the photo he is seated in the first row, and he is the third person going from right to left.  He is wearing blue jeans and a grey sweater, and he has a hat on his head.

He devotes himself to a variety of services such as photocopying, copying keys, and repairing cell phones, among others.  He has been in this business for five months.  He says that he works alone, and he works Mondays through Saturdays.  His business is located in his house.

He will use the loan to buy materials like paper, chips for telephones, gift items, and cell phone cases in order to stock his business.  His goals are to grow each day in his business, to stock it with a variety of merchandise, and to attract more customers.  With this he will have a better quality of life.

Rayner lives with his wife and two daughters, who go to school.  His dreams are to give his daughters a good education so that they will be great professionals in the future.

Rayner is very happy and grateful for the loan and the services given to him by Fondo Esperanza.  Also, he says that he feels very comfortable with the meetings and the group in his communal bank.  They are generous and united.  Regarding the trainings given at the meetings, he has learned to run his business in a better way.

Chillán is a community in the central district of southern Chile. Its name means “Window of the Sun” in the Mapudungun language, which is spoken by the Maupuche indigenous people. Chillán is also known as the “Cradle of the Nation” and the “Land of Artists” because many well-known figures in Chile’s history were born there, such as the famous pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: Comprará insumos como papeles, artículos de regalo, articulos de escritorio y toner.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is aged 36. She is a mother of five children and all of the children go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has spent 12 years in the same business. With the loan, she will buy more beans, sorghum, and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay for beans, sorghum, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Estrella Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Estrella del Futuro” está conformado por 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; restaurantes, venta de empanadas, confección, venta de bolsas plásticas, feriantes, bazar, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Lorena, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste pantalón de color negro, lleva puesto un chaleco con rayas de color blanco, rojo y negro, su cabello es de color oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la confección de vestuario, se dedica a este rubro desde hace 2 años, comenta que trabaja sola en su casa de lunes a viernes desde las 9ºº hasta las 19ºº horas.
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en la ciudad independencia que se especializa en vender telas, además que compra a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará telas, hilos, para sus confecciones.
Sus metas son adquirir más  maquinas y tener gente trabajando en su negocio para incrementar sus ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Lorena vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como obrero en construcción y su hija de 11 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel personal son poder estudiar alguna carrera para obtener un título y trabajar en otro rubro.
Lorena está muy agradecida y contenta del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza ya que le abrió una puerta para invertir en su negocio. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank called "Estrella del Futuro" is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who dedicate themselves to different jobs, among which are: restaurants, sale of empanadas, baking, sale of plastic bags, festivals, sale of goods, and services among others. All of them belong to the community of San Bernando located in the city of Santiago. 

Lorena, president of the communal bank, is seated in the first row second from the right in the photo with black pants and a red, white and black striped shirt. She works sewing clothes and has been doing this for the past 2 years. She notes that she works alone from home, Monday through Friday from 9am to 7pm.

She usually buys her merchindise in the city of Independencia, which specializes in selling fabrics at a low price and is very economically convenient. With this loan she will buy fabric, thread, and linings for her clothing. Her goals are to acquire more machines and to have people working in her business to increase their income, and thereby achieve a better quality of life. 

Lorena lives with her husband who works as a construction worker, and their daughter who is 11 years old and in school. Her dream on a personal level is to be able to study a career one day to obtain a degree and work doing something else.

Lorena is very grateful and happy for this loan and the services provided by Fondo Esperanza as it opened a door for her to invest in her business. Aditionally, she tells us that she feels very comfortable in the meetings of her communal bank, as there exists much generosity and unity.

San Bernardo is a city located 18km in a straight line to the south of the main square of Santiago (the capital of Chile). It is known as the capital of folklore, as the "International Folklore Festival" takes place there every year in January, an event in which artisans of nearby countries as well as those from Chile participate. Later in the year, in April, an event called "Abril Cuecas Mil" takes place, which consists of a traditional Chilean dance performed by the entire community.

loans.use: comprará telas, hilos, para sus confecciones.

loans.name: Hersilia

texts.es: Hersilia, una mujer de 64 años de edad, trabajó como empleada de varios restaurantes durante 25 años, pero su espíritu libre e independiente la llevaron a que emprendiera su propia aventura de negocios; así fue como tradujo toda esa experiencia en la forma de generar ingresos de manera autónoma, abriendo su propio restaurante; Por eso después de haber logrado enfrentar muchos desafíos como su viudez y la pérdida de su hijo mayor en un accidente, logró con sus esfuerzos hacer ahorros para comprar mercancías variadas, pero este dinero lo perdió pues fue robada. Ante esto, una buena vecina la ayudó con otra pequeña cantidad de dinero que le regaló y con ello gestionó en un parque su emprendimiento inicial, vendiendo sopas; Hersilia para formalizar su estadía allí, tramitó los permisos respectivos para instalarse. Con ese negocio, que poco a poco fue creciendo, hasta convertirse hoy en un restaurante, logró educar a sus 5 hijos que en la actualidad se encuentran en las edades de 31 a 38 años. Su meta es organizarlo mejor, para brindar un ambiente confortable a su clientela; así mismo quiere aumentar sus inventarios para estabilizar un poco el incremento de los precios de los insumos, comprando por volumen y de contado, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará víveres, como aceite, arroz, carnes, huevos y legumbres, así como también utensilios de cocina, sillas y mesas,  con el fin de aumentar sus posibilidades de acceso a nuevos clientes. Su inversión de credikiva será exitosa, porque ganará el descuento de los artículos en doble vía, por su compra en volúmenes y porque no se somete en el periodo, al constante aumento de precios; además porque brindarle un ambiente confortable y bien presentado a sus clientes  potencializa el aumento del número de ellos, lo que en resumes es el objetivo  de Hersilia.
texts.en: Hersilia is a 64-year-old woman who has been employed in a restaurant for 25 years. However, being an independent and free spirit, she decided to start her own activity, and she therefore put all of her experience in opening her own restaurant in order to independently make a living. For this activity she had to face many challenges, notably her old age and the loss of her eldest son who died in an accident, but she succeeded in saving some money she used to buy and sell various products, even thought she lost these products because she was robbed. Knowing this, a good neighbor of hers helped her by lending her a small amount of money and by initially managing the set up of her activity in a park by selling soups, while Hersilia was contracting the necessary licenses to work there. Thanks to this activity, that has grown little by little until becoming a restaurant, she succeeded in paying for the education of her 5 children, aged between 31 and 38. Her goal is to better organize her restaurant, in order to offer a comfortable environment to her customers; she also wants to increase her inventory to stabilize a little the rise in the price of the ingredients, by buying in larger volumes and paying cash, but she does not have enough working capital. This is the reason why she is asking for a loan; this is the first loan she requests to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it to buy provisions such as oil, rice, meat, eggs and pulses, as well as cooking tools, chairs and tables in order to give access to more customers. Her investment in this loan will be successful because she will gain a discount in two ways: by buying in larger volumes on one side and by not giving way to the constant rise in prices on the other; on top of this, by offering a comfortable and pleasant environment to her customers she will capitalize on the increase in the number of customers, which in the end is Hersilia’s objective.

loans.use: To buy provisions such as oil, rice, meat, and eggs, as well as cooking tools, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with five children who are all in school. She does not look after any other dependents. Joyce has been selling charcoal in the market for the last eight years, working seven days a week. She depends entirely on this business.

Joyce has requested a loan of UShs 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more sacks of charcoal. Her business challenges include the ever increasing prices and scarcity of supplies, especially in the rainy seasons, when the upcountry roads are impassable.  Her dream is to have capital that is enough for her to purchase charcoal in bulk and direct from the source and also to build rental houses.

Joyce joined MCDT because she could start small and grow with time. She lives in the family house with access to electricity but without piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en: Athanasie is 37 years old. She owns a little shop and she has spent four years in the business. The loan requested will be used to buy more sorghum, beans and rice to sell. The profits from the business are expected to be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as sorghum, beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has four children.  She runs a green grocery business to earn a living.  She has been in the business for three years.  She also does farming to supplement her income.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained oin business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business and employ people.  She has requested 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has three children.  She runs a grocery business to earn a living.  She has been in the business for six years.  She has employed one person in the business.  She also does farming to supplement her income.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business and employ more people.  She has requested 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Fanny Flor

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua brindando el servicio de movilidad escolar,la socia trabaja de lunes a viernes durante el dia,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro realizando el cambio de aceite.
 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Liderando las palmeras".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.  The member continues to offer the service of transportation to school.  She works Monday through Friday during the day.  She has a good time in this business, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in each day.  The member is a happy and responsible person with the desire to continue working for her family.

The member asks for the loan in order to perform maintenance on her car by changing the oil.  She is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the deadline.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her car by changing the oil.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a married woman with four children. Marina is 46 years old and resides in Migpange, Bonifacio, Philippines.

Marina owns and operates a business venture, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more shrimp to sell. Marina is been a member of GDMPC for 3 years. In the future, Marina wants to build a house and for her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy more shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad is  50 years old, married, and has four children. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of food products in the central bazaar. Fuad has 20 years of experience in this field, which would indicate that he is a knowledgeable and skilled person.

 He usually sells rice, macaroni, yoghurt, flour, butter, sugar and others. The products he sells are in very high demand and people use them in everyday life.  His monthly profit is 200 AZN. His spouse helps him to update merchandise in his shop. 

This business is the only financial income in his family and Fuad would like to increase his sales as well as to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1000 AZN.  He will use this loan to purchase more products to sell.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two of these children attend school. She does not look after any other dependents. She has been running a shop for motorcycle spare parts for the last six years, working seven days a week. She does not operate any other business.

Aisha has requested a loan of UShs 200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy some spare parts that are missing from the shop. Her challenges include periods when there is general scarcity of money and also the high prices at which she acquires the spare parts.  Her dream is to be able to buy all the spare parts that her customers request. 

Aisha joined MCDT because she could not raise all the money she needed to run her business. She resides in her husband's house that does not have access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es:
Bruno esta casado y tiene un hijo, vive en una casa en anticretico en la zona Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente él y su esposa perciben ingresos ya que ambos son comerciantes de ropa y también tienen una tienda de abarrotes en la casa de sus padres es por eso que solicitan el crédito para la compra de más enseres para su tienda como ser enlatados y refrescos por cantidad para mejorar sus ingresos ya que deben cubrir los gastos de alimentación y gastos médicos ya que no cuentan con un seguro.
El sueño de Bruno, es tener más ingresos y comprarse una casa  ya que desea dar más comodidad a su familia y tener su tienda propia ya que la distancia de su casa a la tienda es lejana.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Bruno is married and has one child. He lives in a rented house in the District of Bajo Llojeta in the city of La Paz. He and his wife currently earn their income as clothing merchants. They also have a grocery store at his parents' house, so he is requesting a loan in order to buy more provisions such as canned goods and soft drinks in large quantities so the he can improve their earnings. This will enable them to cover the cost of food and medical expenses since they do not have insurance.

Bruno's dream is to have more income and to buy a house because he wants his family to be more comfortable and to have store that is much closer in distance since his parents' house where his current store is located is so far away. This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Juana solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder establecer y cultivar una  manzana de piña y así poder tener nuevos ingresos a su hogar, con este cultivo ella podrá mejor su forma de vida ya que en estos momentos  la piña está en plena cultivación con este financiamiento comprara los hijos de piña para sembrarlos y su respectiva urea  y fertilizante
Ella agradece a Afodenic por confiar en ella nuevamente.
texts.en:
Juana is asking for a new loan to be able to set up and cultivate a plot of land to grow pineapples, so as to be able to provide a new source of income for her home.  With this fruit she will be able to improve her quality of life as pineapple is currently in season.  She will buy pineapple seeds to sew, as well as urea and fertilizer, with the loan.

She is grateful to Afodenic for having faith in her and her new venture.

loans.use: to buy pineapple seeds to sew and cultivate

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid is 54 years old and married with two children. He is a farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 18 years. During these years Vahid gained enough skills and experience  to run the business. He chose this produce business because it  is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan families and also used to make fresh punch. Vahid usually sells his produce in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Vahid wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio es un padre de familia de 60 años de edad, con hijos ya independizados. Vive junto a su esposa en el caserío Cruz del Médano, uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Mórrope. La zona se caracteriza por tener una población humilde y muy apegada a sus tradiciones. 

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría sus animales en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta con polvillo (derivado del arroz), maíz, purina y pastos naturales. Cuando estos alcanzan un buen nivel de desarrollo empieza a venderlos quincenalmente. Adicionalmente trabaja como agricultor y jornalero en los campos de cultivos cercanos.

Emilio desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para sus animales, de modo que puedan desarrollarse más rápido y pueda obtener mayores ingresos de sus ventas, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

El ya ha tenido créditos con nuestra institución anteriormente y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Emilio is a family man. He is 60 years old, and his children are grown and live on their own. He lives with his wife in the small village of Cruz del Médano, one of the hamlets which constitute Mórrope agricultural district. The area is know for its humble people, who are very devoted to their traditions. 

He works raising and selling animals. He raises his animals in farmyards located in the back area of his house. He feeds them rice powder, corn, purine, and natural grasses. When they reach a good level of development he starts selling them every two weeks. He also works in agriculture and as a laborer in nearby crop fields.

Emilio wants to acquire balanced feed for his animals, so that they may develop faster and he may obtain higher income from his sales. That is why he has requested 3,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. He expects to achieve his goals with this loan.

He has received loans from our institution in the past and has proved to be a timely and responsible client.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed and improve his business, which is raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo, sus dos hijos, sus sobrinas y su padre en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega desde hace siete años instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por sus dos hijos cuando ella no se encuentra. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de animales de corral. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Debido a la acogida  de su bodega Eulalia desea adquirir más productos de primera necesidad y  bebidas gaseosas para surtir su bodega, además de comprar producto balanceado para sus animales, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1400 nuevos soles.

Eulalia es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Eulalia is a 46 year old mother.  She lives together with her husband, two children, her nieces and her father in Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area in Piura region, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Eulalia has a small grocery store in her home which she has run for seven years.  Her two children serve in the store when she is not there.  They sell basic food products, basic household products, groceries, candies and soda to their neighbors and other customers in the area.  The business is very popular.  In addition, Eulalia also raises farmyard animals.  Through these businesses, she helps her husband financially support their family.

As Eulalia's store is doing well, she would like to acquire more basic household products and soda to sell.  She would also like to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,400 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Eulalia is a hard-working and very good-natured woman.  Those who know her have a lot of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: to buy products for her store (basic household products, candies, groceries, soda, etc.) and also nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Carmen Olimpia

texts.es: Carmen viven en Duran junto a su familia. Hace 6 años con muchos esfuerzos pudieron adquirir un solar donde construyo su casa mixta de 2 plantas. Su esposo José es maestro albañil dedicándose a la construcción, tiene 2 hijos quienes asisten a la escuela fiscal. A sus 39 años Carmen se dedica a la venta de joyas y productos de belleza. Empezó el negocio gracias a su esposo quien le dio el capital inicial, lleva 3 años en el mismo y siente que no lo a defraudado. El negocio lo realiza sola recorriendo su barrio visitando a sus cliente, los productos los deja en su domicilio para evitar los robos, solo lleva muestras y fotos de los mismos para ofrecer. Su horario de trabajo es de mañana y tarde dependiendo del tiempo de sus clientes lo hace de esta manera ya que al principio no tenía mucha competencia. Espera con el crédito comprar jobones corporales, desodorantes, perfumes, maquillaje para ofrecer variedad. Su sueño a futuro es poder terminar la construcción de su casa ya que la parte superior es de madera.
texts.en: Carmen lives in Duran with her family.  Six years ago, with a lot of effort, she was able to acquire solar energy equipment for the 2 story house she built.  Her husband, Jose, is a master builder who works in construction.  They have two children who attend public school.  Carmen, 39, has a business selling jewelry and beauty products.  She started this business thanks to her husband, who gave her the startup capital.  She has been working in this business for 3 years, and it has not disappointed her.  She runs the business on her own, going around her neighborhood visiting customers.  She leaves the products in her house to avoid theft; she only brings samples and photos to show to her customers.  Her working schedule is in the mornings and afternoons, depending on the time her customers have.  She does it this way, because at first she didn't have a lot of competition.  She hopes with this loan to buy body washes, deodorants, perfumes and makeup so that she can offer a variety of products.  Her dream for the future is to be able to finish building her house, because the upper story is made of wood.

loans.use: to buy body washes, deodorants, perfumes and makeup

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa propia es pequeña y solo tiene dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo, la misma esta ubicada en la zona Vino Tinto de la ciudad de La Paz.
Emiliana estudio solamente hasta la secundaria, actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como empleada en una entidad pública de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja por más de ocho horas ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de un muro de contención en su vivienda ya que en tiempos de lluvia es muy peligroso, de esta forma  mejorara su nivel de vida.
El sueño que tiene Emiliana es construir más habitaciones en su casa y tener más comodidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Emiliana is single and has no children. She lives in her home, which is small and only has two rooms with brick walls. Her home is located in the District of Vino Tinto in the city of La Paz.

Emiliana only has a high school education. She currently receives an income by working as an employee for a public entity in the city of La Paz. Emiliana works more than eight hours so that she can cover expenses such as food and basic services. The loan she is requesting will be used to build a retaining wall for her home because the conditions can be very dangerous when it rains. This will also improve her standard of living.

Emiliana dreams of adding more rooms to her house so that she can be more comfortable. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to build a retaining wall to provide more security for her home.

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,ella tiene un restaurant,ella prepara almuerzos y cenas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,carne y verduras al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mariza is continuing with her business selling food.  She has a restaurant where she prepares lunches and dinners.  She works from 8am until 7pm, and through this business she is providing for her children.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant business.  She is requesting a loan to buy food products, such as rice, meat and vegetables, at wholesale.  

Mariza is pleased with this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat and vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Roselline

texts.en:
Roselline is married and has three children.  She runs a green grocery business to earn a living.  She has been in the business for eight years and has managed to employ one person. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business further and employ more people.  She has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy onions, tomatoes, cabbages and carrots.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, cabbages and carrots

loans.name: Preng

texts.en:
Preng is a fifty-four-year-old married man with three children ranging from twenty-three to eighteen years old. Two of his children are still attending school. Livestock has been the type of business that Prenge has been involved in from the very beginning of the communist regime's collapse. During that regime, his family including him were all persecuted and relocated to concentration camps for unknown reasons, just like so many others in Albania. Starting a new life back in his native village was difficult in the beginning; however, thanks to the welcoming people, the transition went smoother than he expected.

His wife has joined him recently in the livestock activity and with joined forces now they want to expand the business and add one more cow. This is the reason that they are applying for a loan through VisionFund Albania and this would be Preng’s first loan. 

Responsibility is Preng's strongest trait and he is confident that he will repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Leni

texts.es:
Leni es madre soltera y tiene un hijo pequeño, vive en la casa de sus tíos ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella, estudio solo hasta la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como mesera por más de ocho horas al día en una empresa privada ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, gastos médicos y servicios básicos de su hijo ya que no cuenta con otros ingresos.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su habitación ya que las paredes se encuentran muy desgastadas y desea darle seguridad a su hijo.
El sueño de Leni, es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Leni is a single mother and has a young son. She lives at the home of her aunt and uncle, where she occupies only one room. The house is located in the District of Obrajes in the city of La Paz.

Leni only has a high school education and currently works as a waitress for more than eight hours each day at a private establishment. This enables her to cover expenses such as food, health care, and basic services for her son since she has no other income. The loan she is requesting will be used to renovate a room in which the walls have greatly deteriorated. She wants to provide safer conditions for her son.

Leni's dream is to improve her income and become independent so that her son can have a better quality of life. This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO, but the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to renovate the room that she shares with her son.

loans.name: Karen Lizet

texts.es:
Karol tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y no cuenta con hijos, vive junto a sus padres en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, en la región Piura.

Se dedica desde hace más de cuatro años a la venta de ropa la cual la realiza recorriendo los caseríos cercanos en donde cuenta con clientes conocidos, trabaja tanto al crédito como al contado, adicionalmente entrega su mercadería a pedido de sus clientes. 

Karol desea adquirir mas prendas de vestir de temporada para poder ampliar su negocio y satisfacer la demanda que cada día se incrementa más, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo

Ella ya es una cliente conocida en nuestra empresa por su puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. Su espíritu emprendedor y luchador la animan a esforzarse para sacar adelante su negocio. Karol agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con ella a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Karol is 24 years old, single and has no children.  She lives with her parents in one of the small villages that form part of the agricultural district of Tambogrande in the Piura region.  

She has spent more than four years selling clothes.  She does so by travelling to the various small villages close by, where she has regular clients.  She accepts credit as well as cash payments and also offers a delivery service to her clients.

Karol would like to buy more items of clothing for the current season to be able to expand her business and meet client demands, which increase daily.  As such, she felt it would be advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 new soles which would help her to achieve her goal. 

She is already known to our company for her punctuality and responsibility when it comes to making her repayments.  Her business mind and fighting spirit push her to push herself to get ahead with her business.  Karol would like to thank in advance the people who will collaborate with her through Kiva.


.

loans.use: to buy items of in-season clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertence al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS;la socia alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de movilidad escolar,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,la socia trabaja de lunes a viernes durante el dia llevando y recongiendo a los niños de sus casas al colegio ,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maria Cecilia belongs to the communal bank "Liderando Las Palmeras."  She alternates her daily activities with her business providing school transportation services.  She has been doing this work for a good amount of time, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day.  She works Mondays through Fridays during the day, transporting children between their homes to their school and back again.  She is a cheerful and responsible person who wants to continue to work for her family so that they can all get ahead.

Maria Cecilia is requesting a loan to do maintenance work on her car.

She feels grateful to be receiving this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on her car

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, one of whom is going to school. She is not looking after any additional family members.

She sells vegetables at the market, retail, a business she has done for the last ten years, working seven days a week.  She also weaves mats to sell.

She has requested a loan of UShs 200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to purchase more vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes and onions for sale and weaving materials in bulk. 

Teopista's challenges include keeping the vegetables fresh especially in the dry season and reduced profits in times of abundance.  Another challenge is being unable to weave at night because of lack of bright light. Her dream is to accumulate profits that will enable her to rent a better house and also start growing vegetables herself.

Teopista joined MCDT to confirm that it was possible to access loans without matching collateral. The house she rents does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are paying for rent, water and kerosene.

loans.use: To buy more cabbages, tomatoes and onions and  raw materials for weaving.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan estudio solo hasta la primaria y actualmente percibe ingresos como albañil contratista, realiza su trabajo por más de doce horas  ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos y gastos médicos de su familia. No tiene otros ingresos.
Juan esta casado y tiene tres hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando solo dos habitaciones, es por eso que requiere el crédito para la construcción de dos habitaciones más para dar más comodidad a su familia.
El sueño de Juan es construir más habitaciones para brindarles más comodidad y de esa forma mejorar su calidad de vida ya  que son cinco integrantes y cada uno necesita su espacio y privacidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan only has an elementary school education and currently earns his income working as a bricklayer-for-hire. He works more than 12 hours since this is the only way he can pay for expenses such as food, basic services, and health care for his family. Juan has no other income.

He is married and has three children who are of school age. Juan lives in his own home, but it only has two rooms. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can build two more rooms in order for his family to be more comfortable. By adding these two rooms, Juan dreams of seeing his family more comfortable and having a better quality of life. Since there five members in his family, each one needs to have space and privacy.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to build two additional rooms in his house.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento Azucenas está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  María ella tiene 42 años y es casada con cinco hijos que tienen las edades de 18, 14, 9, 7  Y 2 años, ella se dedica a la confección de enaguas, que son como faldas de tela delgada que se ponen las señoras de pollera debajo de sus polleras, ella confecciona en  su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de la Circunvalación,   este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de tela por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la compra de distintas maquinarias para elaborar sus prendas  y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando maquinarias y materiales para su negocio y así poder generar mayores ingresos,  La Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora sola saca delante a su familia, esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene, se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos como el de ella mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The bank of entrepreneurship in Azucenas is made up of eight members: seven women and one man.  The president of the bank is Señora María; she is 42-years-old and married with five children who are of the ages 18, 14, 9, 7, and 2.  She makes a living by making petticoats, which are like skirts of thin fabric that women wear beneath their skirts.  She makes them in her shop which is located in the area of Circunvalación.

This loan is her fourth cycle with the institution.  Señora María is going to use this loan to buy wholesale fabric.  Her reason for asking for the loan is she lacks the cash.  Señora María faces challenges in her business, and one is the purchase of various machinery to make her garments. She is going to use the profits to continue buying machinery and materials for her business, and thus be able to generate more income.  

Señora María is a very hard-working person who alone gets her family ahead in life; this is the only work she is able to support it with.  She is happy for the opportunity offered to her by her group partners since in many cases they support their families alone, like she does.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making petticoats.

loans.name: La Piramide Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA PIRAMIDE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.
